If you're looking for a leisurely dining experience, this is the place for you. Just be aware that it's going to take a while for your food to come out. The waitstaff is usually pleasant, but they're young and inexperienced. We've had too many bad experiences with long wait times, so we usually opt for another diner or restaurant on the weekends.
I highly recommend Body Cycle to anyone looking for a great workout, whether you're a beginner or a seasoned pro.

This is a great family diner with a large buffet of eclectic choices. I had a chicken leg, fried jalapeño, tamale, two rolled grape leaves, and fresh melon. They all were good, and there were lots of Mexican choices. The staff was friendly and attentive, and the place was casual and relaxed. It's next to the Clarion Hotel.

If you're looking for an amazing Indian dining experience, look no further than Curry in a Hurry! The lamb curry and korma are both absolutely delicious, and there are 10 different kinds of naan to choose from. Don't let the outside deter you - go in and try something new! You'll be glad you did.

The interior of this place is really cute, and the owner (?) gave us a tour of the upcoming patio/rooftop area, which will be great on days like today. The cheese curds were very good and very filling. I really like that the sandwiches come with a salad, especially after eating too many curds! I had the onion, gruyere, and tomato sandwich. There wasn't too much cheese, which I liked. It needed something else, though...maybe some pepper jelly. I would like to see more menu options added, such as salads with fun cheeses. They have a lot of beer and wine, as well as limited cocktails. Next time I will try one of the draft wines.

If you're looking for terrible service and unaccommodating staff, Dmitris is the place for you! I went in to order take out and was told they were too busy to do it, even though the place was only half full. Save yourself the trouble and go to Kanella instead.

This was an amazing tour and I would highly recommend it to anyone visiting New Orleans for the first time. Our tour guide was incredibly knowledgeable and had a ton of interesting facts and stories about the city. I loved learning about the history and seeing all the different sites. The price was also great, especially with the Groupon. Definitely worth doing if you want to explore New Orleans and learn more about its culture and history.

If you're looking for a delicious meal and some great craft beer, this is the place for you! The wings are some of the best I've ever had, and the bleu cheese is homemade and amazing. The ribeye was tender and perfectly prepared, and overall everything was just delicious. I would definitely recommend checking out this hidden gem!

If you're looking for a pretty national forest to visit, Los Padres is a great choice. However, the staff could do a better job of keeping the area clean. There's a lot of dead grass around, and the water is pretty dirty. Cachuma lake looks much nicer and well-maintained in comparison.

If you're looking for a fun and lively hibachi experience, this is not the place for you. Our waitress brought our sushi orders on one plate and forgot several items, which was surprising given that the restaurant was pretty quiet. The hibachi cook, Francisco, was good but didn't say much. Overall, the service was fishy, the food was pretty good, and I'm hoping it was just an off night. For the money, though, I wouldn't go back.

I had a great experience at Shalimar. I brought my engagement ring in to get sized and they were able to do it same-day. The associates were very understanding and accommodating when I made a mistake and needed the ring resized. They did it for free and even got it back to me within an hour. I'm very grateful for such a wonderful experience.

If you're looking for an amazing breakfast or brunch spot in Indianapolis, you have to check out Milktooth! The locals recommended it to me and I'm so glad I had the chance to experience it. The food was incredible and the atmosphere was perfect. I will definitely be back the next time I'm in town!

I absolutely love going to this place for happy hour or dinner! The patio is great with fans to beat the St. Louis heat. They're also very accommodating at this location. I like the Veal Milanese but with mixed greens instead of pasta. They'll modify the menu to suit your taste!
. I ordered the gnocchi with marinara and it was fantastic. The baked eggplant appetizer was also very tasty. If you can get past the slow service, the food is worth it.

The bun makes the Sonoran Dog. It's like a snuggie for the pup. At first, it seems ridiculous and almost like it's going to be too much, exactly like everyone's favorite blanket with sleeves. Too much softness, too much smush, too indulgent.  Wrong. It's warm, soft, chewy, fragrant, and it succeeds where other famed Sonoran Dogs fail.

The hot dog itself is flavorful, but I would prefer that it or the bacon have a little more bite or snap to better hold their own against the dominant mustard and onions.

I'm with the masses on the carne asada caramelo. Excellent tortilla, salty, melty cheese, and great carne.

Super cheap and you can drive through.

If you're looking for a great place to have breakfast, look no further than this place! I had the waffle, which was fluffy and perfect, and home fries which were nice and smashed and crunchy. The waitstaff were also very friendly, which made the experience even better. I will definitely be back!

If you're looking for a top-tier dining experience without having to travel across the country, look no further than _____! The food is delicious and the service is impeccable. Douglas went above and beyond to make sure our experience was perfect. The only downside is that it's a bit on the pricey side, but it's definitely worth it for a special occasion.

If you're looking for a delicious meal that's also Celiac-friendly, look no further than this spot! The servers and bartenders are extremely knowledgeable about the menu and can make great recommendations for substitutions, omissions, etc. to make your meal safe and enjoyable. The food is absolutely amazing, and the wine and cocktail menus are spot-on. My only wish is that they had a gluten-free dessert option, but that's a minor complaint in the face of everything else this place has going for it. I'll definitely be back again and again!

I go to blow bar to get my brows done by Natalie (brow specialist) which I highly recommend she is great does a great job on my eyebrows! But then I got a blow by Victoria!! Wow I was impressed I have thin, straight, dead hair and she left me with the biggest volume I've ever had!!! Tried another girl but didn't like it as much so Victoria will be my girl forever; very beautiful clean place!!!

This is my absolute favorite cafe in the city. Their black and white latte is probably the best I've ever had (not too sweet and just the right amount of foam), soups are always really good (even for non-soup people) and there's just a lot of space to do work. The noise level is perfect, the music is at a perfect level, and I always enjoy when patrons bring their dogs. I'll keep giving them my business for as long as I can.

HOLY SMOKES! This place is amazing! The frozen custard is mixed with actual pumpkin pie and it is incredible! The best part is the chunks of pie crust. It's like finding a diamond inside another diamond. Super yummy!

I was excited to try Upland's pizza, but I was disappointed. The margherita pizza had a cracker-like crust and was pretty light overall. The cheese was good, but the other toppings didn't add much flavor. There was no red sauce, which is typical for a margherita pizza. I think Upland's pizza would be a good appetizer for a group, but I'll stick with their burgers or tenderloins as my meal of choice on future visits.
I thoroughly enjoyed the show. It was a chill way to spend a Friday night. I would definitely recommend it to anyone looking for a fun night out.

If you're in the mood for sushi and don't want to drive to the city, this is the place for you! The salmon is our favorite, but everything we've had here has been delicious. The service is always friendly and quick, and the prices are reasonable.

I was really between 3 and 4 stars for this one. I LOVE the 96th street Naked Tchopstix so I was very excited to see this one which is closer to my house.
The vibe is totally different as this is geared more to take out although they do have a decent size dining area. You order at the counter and they deliver it.
My daughter and I tried the sushi bowl. You pick up a piece of paper and  select from a choice of proteins, vegetables, rice and toppings. I like the fact that it is on paper and you don't have to guess what things are or have to shout over the counter to tell the server what you want. The sushi bowl was good but not wonderful. The choices particularly of the vegetables seemed a little too limiting and I felt I had more rice than other food items. The sauces were tasty. My husband ordered the Maui roll which is my favorite roll at the 96th street location and this
If you're looking for some good BBQ, this is the place to go! The beef brisket sandwich is awesome - so juicy and tender. The pulled pork was just as good. Definitely worth a visit!
This is the best Thai food in the area! Everything was authentic and delicious. Will definitely be back again and again.
If you're looking for a disappointing last meal in town, this is the place for you! The service was terrible and the food was just okay. Save yourself the trouble and go somewhere else.
The food here is amazing! The service is great and the ambiance is perfect for a romantic dinner. We will definitely be returning soon!

I at least have to give this restaurant two stars due to the decent food. But while on a dinner meeting and after spending $100 on entrées and appetizers, I had to flag down the assistant cook, (the guy in bright red baggy pants watching TV), to see if I could get more avocado for my tuna entrée. He made it very apparent and direct that he could not help me with that situation and I would have to flag down my  waitress so she could bill me for the four dollar avocado.

I was really disappointed with the service at this restaurant. I understand that the avocado was an extra, but the assistant cook could have at least been more polite about it. I definitely won't be coming back here.

If you're looking for a cozy spot with amazing food and great service, look no further than this gem! I was blown away by how quickly the food came out and how delicious it was. The waitstaff were all so friendly and funny, it really felt like I was dining in someone's home. I will absolutely be back!

Burgers were great! Fries and salad too! The burgers had a hint of salt and pepper flavor which was delicious! The outdoor seating was very quaint and the staff was friendly. Street parking as well as parking lot in the back.

I absolutely love this place! The staff is always so helpful and nice. The store is always clean and huge, and it always stays stocked with everything you need. The staff always helps make my custom breakfast bagel, and it's always delicious. I highly recommend this place to anyone!

I took my vehicle to Kevin's a few years ago for a manufacturer recall. The problem went away, but then I started hearing another noise. I thought it was related, but Kevin's mechanic lifted my car right up and fixed the issue FREE OF CHARGE. He could have charged me, but he didn't. Outstanding individual! Highly recommend!

If you're looking for a delicious and refreshing frozen treat, Sweet CeCe's is the place to go! They have a great selection of toppings, both healthy and not-so-healthy, to customize your order. Sometimes the girls working there can be a little distracted or hard to find, but they're always willing to help when you need it. And don't forget to take advantage of their $5 Friday deal!

If you're in the Funk Zone and looking for a place to grab a bite or do some wine tasting, Santa Barbara Wine Collective is a great option. They have a great selection of wines, and the food is delicious. We had a savory croissant that was fantastic. The staff is also very friendly and helpful.

I had a great experience at this massage center! The therapists are all very professional and the environment is relaxing. I was able to get a same-day appointment, which was great. I would definitely recommend this place to anyone looking for a good massage.

The Peppermill is a huge hotel with plenty of restaurants and a huge casino. The valet parking is a nice touch and the room was large and had a great view of the pool area. The staff were all courteous and helpful. We enjoyed our stay.

If you're looking for a great deli with tons of options, you'll definitely want to check out this place! I had a turkey, avocado & bacon panini and my boyfriend had a buffalo chicken wrap, and both were really tasty. The wait for food wasn't too long, which is always appreciated during lunch hour. We'll definitely be back!
The biscuits at this place are amazing, and the cocktails are great too. Highly recommended. A bit busy though.

If you're looking for a good meal and a unique atmosphere, look no further than this fishing lodge-themed restaurant! The food was cooked perfectly and the menu has a good variety of options between Outback and Bonefish. We went on a Groupon and were very pleased with our experience. We will definitely be back!
. I give up. If you want cheap food go here but don't expect anything else. The waitress was the best part.

The only reason I didn't give this restaurant a 5 star rating, is because of one single pretentious waiter. As a 4 night guest at Hotel Palomar, the location of the restaurant is an obvious plus. The first night of my stay, I met a coworker in the restaurant for a cocktail. When we arrived, the host staff were busy and not available, so we just walked in. The restaurant was not too busy, so we just looked at a small table next to the bar and proceeded to take a seat. A waiter came by and I quickly asked if we could have a seat, before sitting down and told him we'd only be having cocktails. He stumbled on his reply, and in an irritated/in-convinced tone, told me "I guess it would be fine" and basically just kept walking mid sentence. My guest and I brushed it off, and started having a conversation while looking at the drink menu. To make a long story short

If you're looking for a great place to get some coffee and food after a morning walk in the park, this is the place for you. The coffee is great and the customer service is even better. I love the vibe in here - it's always so positive and welcoming.

If you're looking for a disappointing dining experience, then look no further than GW Fins! The food took forever to come out, and what finally arrived was overcooked and overpriced. The burger was way overcooked (especially when I ordered it medium rare), and the seafood jambalaya was just decent. There are better places to eat in the French Quarter - this place was not horrible, but it was not worth all the hype.
If you don't mind a little wait for the elevator, this place is great! Comfortable bed, good breakfast, fast internet, and great location. Low price is a huge bonus.

If you enjoy being treated like a second-class citizen and enjoy sitting in dirty lawn chairs in a dirty yard, then this is the place for you! The so-called wait staff is only mildly helpful, as you have to go to the window and pay cash for your food. The live music is the only redeeming quality of this place. Once is enough for me!

If you want to pay for everything a la carte, this is the place for you. The food wasn't terrible, but it wasn't impressive. We ordered our food, which was reasonably priced, and asked for sour cream and cheese on the taco. She let us know cheese was extra. It was $2.50 extra for another basket of chips. When I received the bill, we paid more for the condiments than the actual food. Side of sour cream: $2.00, pico de gallo: $2.50, salsa: $2.00, chips: $2.50, cheese: $1.00, and the bottled coke that we didn't want: $5.00. Just a suggestion...when you order anything, make sure to ask if there is an extra charge.

The cafe was extremely cute. We came at 8am and they even had a jazz band playing at that time. I got the breakfast sandwich and it was delicious. I loved how they rolled the egg and put the bacon pieces inside. Great price for a filling breakfast!

I would definitely recommend this place to anyone looking for a great breakfast spot. The atmosphere was really cozy and the food was fantastic.

This place is the bomb! I was so excited to try the duckfat frenchfries and they did not disappoint. The tots were also great. The Kentucky Fried Quail was stellar, and the boy's Fois Gras burger was incredible. This is definitely a place I will be coming back to again and again.

We started with the artichoke dip, big mistake. It was cold and the chips were stale. Mentioned to our waitress, but nothing came of it. We ordered a large pizza, thin crust which after adding toppings it was a bit pricey for pizza. Pizza was ok, not great. Except for not being our advocate our server was good. I have been here before for Cardinals game, it was better then. Will try another venue next time.

If you're looking for a good, laid-back Thai restaurant, Jasmine Rice is a great choice. We ordered the pan-fried dumplings, which were flavorful but not something we'd order again. The green curry fried rice with duck was excellent, and the duck was some of the tastiest we've ever had. The pad thai was a bit sweet for our taste, but still very good. Our service was good, but we noticed that other people were having issues with their service. Overall, good quality Thai food. We would definitely go back.

I absolutely love Courtney! She is hands down the best hairstylist I have ever had. The reason I think she is so great is that she knows what will look best on me and over the past year has understood my limits for styles. I always go into the salon and tell her to cut my hair how she thinks will look best, and I always leave blown away at what she does. You know you have a great stylist when you don't have to specify what you want done, but instead they see what needs to be done. Great stylist, great personality and very knowledgeable. I would highly recommend her to anyone who wants to look their best.
If you need an oil change or state inspection, this place is ok. The key is getting there when they are not busy or else you will wait.
I had my old Lennox units replaced with new ones 3 years ago and couldn't be happier. The guys did a great job and everything has been running smoothly ever since.

The Brewpub is one of my favorite places to go out to eat. They have a great variety of dishes, including nachos, pizza, and sandwiches. They also have a variety of beers that are crafted right on sight. The only downside is that the service is always slow. However, I think it's just the pace of the restaurant. It's never a quick beer and a bite of food. Instead, enjoy the patio and friends, savor that time. The Brewpub is also great for your vegetarian and vegan friends. My go-to is a half order of the nachos or fish & chips. I also tried their Pumpkin Seasonal Beer and it's on par with some of my favorite pumpkins.

If you're looking for a farmhouse, rustic, chic home store in SB, look no further than Farmhouse! The helpful staff has great ideas to decorate your home, and the prices are reasonable. The store has items from Joanna Gaines (Fixer Upper) and much more. I'm so glad we finally have a good home store in SB with reasonable prices!

This place is great! My brother came to visit and we wanted to pick up a six pack of good beers for a night in. Ended up staying and having a few while playing their Nintendo 64 (Super Smash Brothers, which the owner said was donated by fellow patrons). It's a great place with good food and genuinely nice people. Should be a staple in the Northeast.

If you're looking for a great Thai restaurant in the area, look no further than this place! The coconut soup is my go-to dish and it's absolutely amazing. The perfect amount of coconut milk makes it creamy and flavorful, without being too overwhelming. The pad thai is also fantastic. The noodles are chewy and the perfect amount of peanut sauce makes it delicious without being too sweet. The chicken is also cooked perfectly and is very juicy. Overall, I was extremely happy with my meal and will definitely be back!

This is a great little diner with excellent service! The food is classic diner fare and the breakfast is served all day. I came here for lunch and they were busy but very friendly and hospitable. The location is easy to get to off the 295.

If you're looking for a place to drink and watch the game on a Saturday night, Lucy's is the place to be. The food is better than expected, and the wings and fries are my go-to. Just be careful of the wtf sauce - it's pretty spicy! Sometimes it takes a while to get the bartender's attention, but that's because the place is usually packed. And if you're lucky, you might even spot the cast of It's Always Sunny in Philadelphia!

The Shellfish Company on the Wharf is a great place to go for a seafood feast! The special of the day was California Rock Crab, and it did not disappoint. The crab was juicy and full of flavor. The bisque soup was also amazing. I would definitely recommend this place to anyone looking for a great seafood meal.

I absolutely love Weaver's Way! I definitely disagree with some of the things said in previous reviews- it is not meant to be a convenience store and I find that as a single woman, I have no trouble shopping here, even during peak times. I actually think it's a great place to shop if you live alone because you can get smaller quantities of items than at corporate stores like Acme. I also enjoy the work hours- I've worked throughout the store, but most recently I have been getting in my hours by participating in the membership committee. I wouldn't say that the community is necessarily made up of "tree huggers" and "earth children", though. The community is made up of a variety of similarly-minded folks from different backgrounds. I enjoy having a place to go to where I can obtain locally grown produce, a place that offers more natural, wholesome, and preservative-free foods than chain stores with prices way below that of Whole Foods. I enjoy

If you're looking for some good BBQ, this place is definitely worth checking out. The food is pretty good, and there's a wide variety of options to choose from. However, it's not my personal favorite BBQ spot. I prefer places that have a bit more of a home-cooked feel to them.

The TV shows are $4.99 and they have commercials! What a cheesy way to make money and a sign of a less than classy hotel, particularly when you pay more than $150 a night.  And there is NO complimentary breakfast, just an overpriced buffet, something even the cheapest hotels in California provide.

I was so disappointed with my stay here. The TV shows are overpriced and there are commercials! This is such a cheap way for the hotel to make money, and it's a sign that the hotel is not very classy. I also didn't appreciate that there was no complimentary breakfast. The buffet was overpriced and not up to the standards of even the cheapest hotels in California. I would not recommend this hotel to anyone.

If you're looking for a great pizza place near your hotel, look no further than this place! The staff are super friendly and accommodating, and the buy one get one deal is awesome. The hot wings are also delicious - they're smothered in sauce, which is exactly how I like them. I'll definitely be back next time I'm in town.

If you like cannoli, if you don't think you like cannoli, you should definitely get one from Termini Bros. The cannolis here are awesome - they're freshly filled when ordered and the filling is phenomenal. Not too sweet, it's perfect.

This is a great little cafe with delicious home-cooked food. The staff is friendly and welcoming, and the food is fresh and tasty. We stopped here twice during our RV trip and were very happy with our meals. Highly recommend this place if you're looking for some good, down-home cooking.
If you're looking for a good pho spot that isn't overrated, this is the place to go. The staff is friendly and the pho is damn good.
If you're looking for a great breakfast spot in town, look no further than this place! The food is always top-notch and the service is impeccable. I highly recommend it to anyone.

The kayaking tour at the Santa Cruz Island was great. My husband and I had a wonderful time. Jen, our tour guide, was helpful and informative. We had a lot of fun exploring the caves. We didn't expect much but this tour definitely exceeded our expectation. We would definitely recommend this tour to anyone looking for a fun and adventurous way to explore the Santa Cruz Island.
If you're looking for a delicious meal at a reasonable price, this is the place for you. The shrimp and goat cheese crepes are a must have!

The first time I ate at Urban Chestnut was a few weeks ago, and I'm ashamed to admit that I've lived in the STL area for over 10 years. I missed out on this St. Louis tradition for so many years!

This place is amazing. What's not to love? It's a factory where you can get a tour (Friday-Sunday, noon-5pm on the hour), there's a shop, bar, and dining area. They also host many events with live music on the weekends. It's fun to just kind of wander and look around - don't worry, you'll get a chance because there will likely be a wait before you dine.

The beer is, of course, amazing. The Hefeweizen is my personal favorite and a great start for anyone who is not a huge beer drinker (like myself). Additionally, the food is homegrown and damn good. I had the pizza (recommendation from

If I could give this place a zero, I would. I ordered a plain hamburger, and realized they put bacon in it (which I am allergic to and unable to eat) after two bites. When I went back to the drive-through window to complain (didn't realize the actual restaurant was open--it was almost 2 after all...), the guy took back the burger, said nothing, and disappeared. After 2 minutes of awkwardly making conversation with the next people in line in their car, he came back and rudely told me I had to go inside to get my food. Which I did. And still did not get an apology.

I refuse to go back there after that ordeal, which is a shame, because it's nice to have a variety of places to go to after DT. Guess Freebirds it is!
I had a great experience at this car wash! The staff was friendly and my car came out looking great. I will definitely be back!

If you're looking for a delicious, reasonably priced sushi spot on the eastside, look no further than Sushi Nara! The sushi is always fresh and there's a huge selection to choose from. The staff is friendly and accommodating, and the service is fast. We've been going since they opened a few months ago and we haven't been disappointed yet!

If you're looking for a great selection of tires and parts, this is the place to go! The owner is very knowledgeable and passionate about his work, and you can tell he cares about providing his customers with the best possible products and service. I would definitely recommend this shop to anyone!

If you're looking for a delicious and affordable meal in Florissant, look no further than this hidden gem. The Panang curry is my personal favorite, but everything on the menu is sure to please. I haven't been to their sister restaurant, but I'm not sure why I would need to when I'm always so satisfied with the food here.

If you're in the mood for some Italian fare, this place is definitely worth checking out. The menu has a lot of great-sounding options, and the space is really cute. Unfortunately, the food didn't quite live up to the hype for me. My tomato-basil soup was pretty bland, and my tuna melt had an overpowering citrus flavor that was really off-putting. I'll definitely be back, though, to try some of the other dishes. And the baked goods sounded really good, too!

If you're looking for a disappointing veggie pizza and an average sub sandwich, this is the place for you! The tomato sauce was bland, and they didn't use enough cheese on the pizza. The dough was dry and tasted like it came from a box. Maybe they've improved since we visited, but we're not in any hurry to find out.

I'll have to come back and try some of their other flavors.

Overall, a decent place for some late night ice cream. I'm not in a hurry to come back, but I would if I were in the area and had a craving.

The staff at this restaurant went above and beyond to make my mother's 100th birthday special. They treated us like royalty, giving us a great table with a view, delicious complimentary dishes, and a beautifully decorated cake plate. The servers were warm and attentive, making sure we had everything we needed. It was a wonderful experience that we will never forget.
The burger was fresh and delicious. The fries were crispy. I will definitely be back to try more of their menu.

If you're in the area and looking for a place to eat, this place is decent. The food is just okay, nothing to write home about, but it's a decent place to eat. The oysters are a good deal, and the seafood to-go is also a good option. The server was friendly and recognized us each time we came in. However, the bathroom could use a good cleaning.

Skip this place if you are looking for dinner. Our server was clueless...like we seriously thought she was lost in the restaurant. Had to ask for setups, water refills, etc. Ordered chicken parmesan and got eggplant parmesan instead with a fish bone in it. The drinks were good.

I found TDS on yelp and decided to give it a try. Meh is all I can say. The restaurant itself is just cold.... not literally, but figuratively. There was no decor, no menu boards, stainless steel prep tables as dining tables, no soda machines, staff EVERYWHERE with no identification (shirts, nametags, etc). The food is reasonably priced and most of it was quite good, but what really irked my party was the fact that they charge for extra salsa!!! We ordered a salsa trio (which included 3 samples of the various salsas, in 2oz glass prep bowls), and when my brother asked for more salsa for his tacos (mind you, we ordered one of ever taco, three burritos and guacamole), he was told he'd have to buy the trio again! Really!!??? We spent over $40 on food, drinks and apps, too. Even though the food was decent, I wouldn

If you're looking for a photographer who will not only take amazing pictures, but also make sure you have a great time doing it, then Angela Clifton Photography is the business for you! We have used them three times now and have loved every single photo they've taken of us. The prices are also very reasonable. We will definitely be using them again in the future!

If you're looking for a good meal and don't mind spending a bit of money, this is the place for you. The food was great and I loved being able to sit at a table outside. If you want a more quiet dining experience, Side Street in the French Quarter is a good option.

The court house is very old and the art is great. The spiral staircase is funny. One can get view of entire city from 5th level. The tower clock room is really surprising with all mechanical gears inside!! You need a prior appointment to get into clock room. Worth spending 2 to 3 hours of time here.

I really enjoyed my visit to the court house. The art was beautiful and the spiral staircase was funny. I was able to get a great view of the city from the 5th level. The tower clock room was really surprising. I was amazed by all of the mechanical gears inside. I would definitely recommend spending 2 to 3 hours here.

I had the pleasure of meeting Ann today, and she was extremely helpful and positive. She went above and beyond to make my first experience here amazing, and she made me an absolute regular customer from this day forward. Thanks, girlie!!

If you're looking for a great Thai meal in Carp, look no further than this restaurant. I was pleasantly surprised by the quality of both the pad Thai and the coconut soup. The staff and service were both excellent, and the restaurant has a great atmosphere. I'll definitely be back!

This place was so chill and relaxing. When I come back it'll definitely be in my list if stops. Not to mention the artist performing was fun and eclectic  (I mean really, a country version of "Let It Go", what's not to love?)

The Smoothie King Center is a great place to catch a game or a concert. The food options have improved significantly in recent years, and there is something for everyone. The drink options are also great, with full service bars, spiked lemonade, and of course, smoothies. The venue is clean and well-maintained, and the staff is friendly and helpful.

If you're looking for a quick, tasty, and relatively healthy meal, Chipotle is a great option. The steak burrito is my personal favorite, and it always seems to hit the spot when I'm feeling a little under the weather. The service is always friendly and fast, even during the lunch rush, and the restaurant is usually pretty calm and quiet between 2 and 4 pm.

I wasn't expecting much from this new Indian restaurant, but it totally blew me away! The ambience is wonderful, with white table linens, and the food is even better. The chicken 65 was to die for, and the hot sour soup was rich and flavorful. The waitress (Angel) was friendly, attentive and very pleasant. They opened just a week ago, but I'm sure this will soon be the place foodies seek out for real Indian food.

I finally made it into Preservation Hall on my third trip to New Orleans and it was well worth the wait! The show was fantastic and the musicians were insanely talented. The band members were also very engaging and personable, which made for a truly enjoyable experience. The intimate setting was also great, as it allowed for a more personal connection with the music. If you're visiting New Orleans, be sure to catch a show at Preservation Hall - you won't regret it!

If you're looking for a quick, easy, and painless inspection, Keystone Discount Tire is the place for you! I was a new customer and didn't have an appointment, but they were able to squeeze me in. The staff was friendly and knowledgable, and they didn't try to upsell me on anything. My car was in and out in less than an hour, and the inspection was very reasonably priced. I would definitely recommend this place to anyone looking for a quick and easy inspection!

I'm so glad I found this place! My son dropped his phone and the screen cracked. I was sure it was ruined, but the folks here fixed it in less than half an hour. They were professional and courteous, and I'm thrilled that his phone is working again.

Service and management terrible... After messing up all 4 of our orders the waiter got mad and started cursing... The manager offered our drinks to be free.. What a mess. The food was cold and nasty didn't even eat half of it and waited over an hour... I will never dine in any cracker barrel again after this experience...

I have been to a number of dog friendly hotels, but this one was in the heart of the city. I was a little uneasy at first, but the reception was so nice and they even had a welcome kit for my dog with treats, a mat, and dog dishes. Everyone at the hotel was so friendly to my dog, and we even decided to come back an extra night. Thank you Loews!

If you're in the mood for some good Chinese food, this is the place to go. Unfortunately, the quality of the food is not always consistent. I've ordered something that I've been getting for years, and it's usually incredible. But every now and then, it tastes like it was made by a completely different person. So, about 50% of the time, it's excellent. UGH.
I will never go back to this location again.

I was really excited to try Cheu based on the reviews I read, but unfortunately it didn't live up to the hype for me. I didn't like the thick noodles or the extremely salty broth. The service was great and they had a nice selection of beers, but I'm just sorry I wasn't a bigger fan. I hope others try it for themselves and have a better experience than I did.

The new Federal Doughnuts concession at the ballpark is a great addition! The doughnuts and fried chicken are delicious, and it's great to have a gluten-free option available. The pizza, cheesesteaks, brownies, and cookies are all great choices for those with gluten-free diets.
So many reasons to love this place!

This Chick fil A is always busy, but the service is always quick and great! I don't know how they do it, but they always manage to be quick and have exceptional service! This is one of my favorite places to eat!

If you're looking for a healthy lunch option while you're in town, this is the place to go! The salads are always fresh and there's a good variety to choose from. Plus, it's quick so you can get back to exploring the city.

I would highly recommend the Oak Alley and Laura Plantation tour! Our driver was very informative and the schedule was perfect. We were dropped off where we had time before and after the tour for free time to walk around the properties. They are very flexible with drop off locations on the return drive. We got off near Jackson Square and got to enjoy the rest of the afternoon in the French Quarter.

If you're looking for a delicious brunch spot in the city, look no further than this place! The grits with scallions and sour cream are my personal favorite, but everything on the menu is mouth-watering. Just be sure to bring a sweater – the room is always freezing!
This place is the best! The hot dogs and chili dogs are amazing and I go here as often as I can. The service is great and the food is always fresh and delicious.

This is the best local beer spot in town by far! The live music on Saturday was great and the concept is a few notches up from Fig Mountain. I definitely prefer Topa. Even cooler is that you can order incredible food from the Nook Restaurant and walk two feet into Lama Dog, which is part of the Waterline. I love it!!

I had a great experience with this company! The customer service was excellent- we were a little out of their pick up area but they were very accommodating and came and got our group of 7. When we got there we realized we were billed for 8 instead of 7. I called and he refunded my money for the extra ticket in minutes!

The tour itself was SO much fun! We were laughing and smiling and our tour guide was funny! We saw lots of alligators! From babies swimming in the water to full grown ones! We saw turtles and birds too! Our tour guide had a baby alligator we could hold that he's raising until it's a little bigger since it was a late hatch that would have died because of when it was born. The ride back was fun too because we went fast and the guide did some "tricks" with the boat! I highly recommend this tour!!!

Westfall replaced our roof in April and we could not be more pleased! The quality of the roof is excellent, communication was great, and follow up was wonderful. We are very happy we chose this company to replace our roof.

If you're looking for some good vegan food that won't break the bank, this is the place for you. The staff is nice and the food is tasty. I would recommend the Cheesesteak and the sweet potato fries. Just be aware that it's not the best place to eat in, since they're going for a fast food approach.

If you're in the mood for some ramen and don't want to go to a sit-down restaurant, this place is a decent option. The ramen itself is just okay, nothing special, but it's quick and easy. The service is also just okay, nothing to write home about. However, it's a good place to stop for a quick bite if you're in the area and there aren't any other options. I've been here twice and will continue to go back when I'm in the mood for some quick and easy ramen.

This place is amazing! The menu has something for everyone and it is all so clean and trendy. The food is delicious and I definitely recommend going early to avoid the wait. It is so worth it! You will leave feeling so satisfied!

If you're looking for some great barbecue at an affordable price, then look no further than this place! The brisket sandwich is amazing, and the sides (potato casserole, cream spinach, baked beans, green beans) are all wonderful. The drink is also great. Overall, an enjoyable experience.
The food and service was amazing! I only wish they had any vegetarian/vegan options. Can't wait to come back and try more of their delicious food!

The food here is great, but the customer service is terrible. I've been three times and I've had two different older waitresses. They're both really unpleasant to deal with. The owner, on the other hand, is lovely.

If you're looking for a delicious, southern-style breakfast in Nashville, you've got to check out Puckett's Grocery. I first heard about this place on the plane ride over from a Franklin local, and he was right - it's definitely one of the best breakfast spots in the city. We were lucky to miss the rush, according to our waitress, and my corn pancake with bacon, salsa, and sour cream was absolutely savory and delicious. This place will always be a stop on my list when I'm back in the south!

1 star for sure! This is the worst service I have ever experienced. We made an appointment for next Saturday with Michael for full detailing, and he confirmed with us the day before. We showed up on time and he was not there, and his partner Alex told us he was busy and would call us back. We waited for half an hour in our car and there is still no call from him. We headed for our breakfast and came back again at 9:30am hoping to give him another chance. Here comes Alex, his partner opening the shop at 9:30am! 1.5 hours away from our appt time and still no sight of Michael. Alex tried calling Michael and couldn't get hold of him. We gave up!!! What a horrendous experience!

If you're looking for a great moving company that will take care of you and your belongings, look no further than this office! The guys here are top notch and very trustworthy. They took great care of me during my move and even went above and beyond what they should have. I would recommend this office to my mother without hesitation!

The Saint is a lovely hotel with a great lobby, bar, and restaurant. However, the rooms are infested with bugs and the TV doesn't work. We had to switch rooms in the middle of the night because of a roach, and the new room had spiders and dead bugs in the corners. The manager was apologetic but we requested a full refund and left for another hotel.

The Green Project is a great place to find affordable doors and building supplies. I was able to find a new door for my home for only $35. I was also able to donate some of my old building supplies that I no longer needed. This is a great place to help the environment and save money.

1 star 

Worst place I've ever visited. The bouncer was rude and he didn't have to be. This place thinks just cause your on broadway you can treat people bad and over charge. I'm not a tourist I live here and will never visit or recommend.

If you're looking for a great lunch spot with amazing food, look no further than this place! The lunch menu is very affordable, and the food is absolutely delicious. The restaurant is also extremely clean, which is always a bonus. I can't wait to go back!

We were so disappointed with our meal here! We've been coming for years and the quality of the food has really declined. Our artichoke starter was clearly pre-prepared and cold in the middle, the Greek salad was drenched in tasteless dressing and came straight out of a bag, and my grilled yellowtail was overcooked and really inferior. The setting and service are still great, but unless the food quality improves, we won't be back.
I cannot say enough good things about Milktooth. They're my favorite place for brunch and I'm pretty sure they're the reason I love brunch so much now.

The bar and staff are AMAZING. We got a room upgrade for being on our honeymoon and the view was gorgeous. But, the room was not any better than a hilton. It had rust in the tub floor, and some weird stains on the tile. But this was only in the bathroom, so I give it 4 stars! Great staff, but too much for valet so we parked a couple streets down. That was the only other con I would say.

I took the beginning class at Evolve and I loved it. It was perfectly paced, and though the moves weren't difficult, they really stretched me in places I didn't know existed! I even broke a small sweat! But I felt great afterwards! The studio is clean, and I like that I can buy some Beyond Organic food items there too.

If you want the best lobster in town, you have to check out Lobster Haven! The service is great and the seafood is even better. You can tell that the seafood is fresh and the lobster is cooked to perfection. The prices are also very reasonable. I would highly recommend this restaurant to anyone looking for a great seafood meal.
This place is amazing! The happy hour is the best I've ever seen, and the menu is full of fresh and delicious options. The drinks are also amazing, and if I had the time I would come here every day!

This place is the tits, plain and simple. All the barbers have skills enough to hook it up fresh. I've been coming here for 3 years and I've never had any problems. Except for maybe that one time when this dude tried to steal my cut. Tim kept it real though and said "I can't give you the same cut as Ryan." Thanks Tim.
If you love sushi and hibachi, then this is the place for you! The food is always fresh and the service is great. We highly recommend this place to anyone who loves sushi and hibachi.

"

If you're looking for a place to watch some sports and indulge, Chickie's and Pete's is the perfect spot. The food may not be the best you've ever had, but it's still enjoyable, especially when paired with a beer. The crab fries, mussels red, and spicy pull and peel shrimp are all great choices. And if you're feeling adventurous, go for the blue crabs. Just be prepared to get a little messy – there are sinks all around for you to rinse your hands off afterwards.

Keep in mind that if you're visiting during a major sporting event, you probably won't be able to get a table and you'll be surrounded by drunk people. But if you're in the right frame of mind, it can be a lot of fun.

I'm so glad I found Glass Genie! They are prompt and professional, even on a Saturday. I needed a simple mirror fix and they made it easy for me. I have used them in Charlotte and they were great then, too.

If you're looking for a good meal in Union Station, this is a great choice. I had the Ponchartrain, which was very good. The shrimp cocktail and lump crab cake appetizers were also fine, but not wonderful. The drinks and service were perfectly acceptable. We dined outside on the patio since the weather was nice, but the inside looks comfy and a bit less casual.

If you're looking for a unique and cozy place to grab a drink with friends, look no further than The Library! This hidden gem in St. Pete has a warm and inviting atmosphere, complete with low-key background music and attentive staff. The decor is straight out of a Harry Potter movie, and the prices for meat and cheese trays are unbeatable. Whether you're looking for a place to catch up with old friends or meet new ones, The Library is the perfect spot.

Ziggy and his team at Maple Street Patisserie are true artists in the culinary world. The blueberry muffins are life-changing, and the king cakes are fit for a king or queen. The breakfast and lunch options are all top-notch, and I've never been disappointed. Ziggy is always working hard to make sure everything is perfect, and it shows. This is my go-to spot for all things sweet, and I can't recommend it enough.

The Bourbon Black and Bleu burger was really good! It was cooked like I wanted and very tasty. I gave them 3 stars for the wait, though. We had a big party - 4 adults and 5 kids - and it took over an hour to get our food. Shouldn't have taken that long, regardless of how many people were at our table.

If you're looking for a great meal in a cozy setting, Katie's is your spot. The menu has something for everyone, and the daily specials are always worth checking out. The service is friendly and efficient, and the bottomless mimosas on Sundays are the perfect way to start your day. Just be sure to arrive before church lets out, or you may have to wait a bit for a table.

The ice cream was great and it's a really cute and cozy place. I lucked out and found a parking spot on the street, which can be tough in that area. The selection here is huge, so you're sure to find something you'll like. I sampled a couple of unusual flavors before settling on a scoop of cookie monster ice cream on a cone. It was perfect - not too sweet. Definitely worth a visit!

I LOVE this place! I have been coming here for a few years now. It's a little funky, and I would never order say the escargot, for safety reasons, but when it comes to lots of Saki, great rolls, and mountains of rice and Sashimi, this is the way to go. Young atmosphere, loud dance music, and SAKI!

If you're looking for a delicious and reasonably priced meal, this is the place for you. The Backyard Bowl is my favorite, but there are plenty of other great options to choose from. The portions are large, so my husband and I usually split a kids size or large. The ingredients are high quality and filling, so you won't leave here feeling hungry. It can get pretty busy during peak hours, but the food is definitely worth the wait.

If you're in the mood for some gumbo, this place is worth checking out. The service is a bit hit or miss - our server was new and a bit all over the place, but the food was good. The gumbo could use a bit more rice or potato salad, but the presentation was nice. The Sprite was flat, but I didn't really need it anyways.

If you're in the mood for some pancakes, this place is a decent option. The pancakes are pretty sweet, so keep that in mind if you're not a fan of super sugary breakfast foods. It can get a little chaotic when it's busy, but the staff does their best to keep things running smoothly. Prices are reasonable, and they serve breakfast all day long. Nothing too fancy, but it'll hit the spot if you're looking for a classic breakfast.

The staff at this store are amazing! They are always willing to help and make great suggestions. The store is always clean and organized, making it easy to find what you're looking for. We have found some great items here, and we will definitely be back!

This place is amazing! The staff has watched me and now my kids grow up. They're personable and so nice. They're also very prompt with service. Yoli and frank are the absolute best! The food is amazing! I absolutely love their shredded beef burro and cheese crisp. I feel they have true authentic Mexican food.

The service was disappointing; I had to ask for water 3 times before the waitress finally brought it to me. And the venue was pretty lackluster; it was very small and cramped. 

Overall, I was pretty disappointed with my experience. I wouldn't recommend this place if you're looking for a good meal.

If you're looking for some delicious Middle Eastern cuisine, this is the place to go! The food is great and always consistent, which is exactly what I need to keep my tummy happy. Plus, the friendly staff makes dining here a truly enjoyable experience.

If you want the best cannoli in the city, look no further than Potito's Bakery. The cannoli here are miles ahead of Termini's and Isgro's, and the bambino cannoli stuffed cannoli is to die for. The line at Isgro's can get ridiculously long, but Potito's is always quick and easy. I've been coming here for years and will continue to do so for as long as they're in business.

I cannot say enough good things about El Limon! The food is authentic and delicious, and the staff is always pleasant and attentive. The best features are the homemade tamales and free margaritas. Bring the entire family for an amazing Mexican feast! Ole!

I'm giving this joint 4 stars because they have earned it, but they are definitely 5 star material, if they work out a few kinks. Granted, they just opened, so some of the errors I've experienced (I work in the area, so I've been there several times) will probably get worked out and they are more than willing to make corrections and accommodations when they mess up.

But over all, the food is REALLY good. Unlike my fellow Yelp-ers, I would say that ther pizza is not their strong suit - its kinds greasy and not sure if they use 100% mozzarella - tastes like its cut with something cheaper. However, so far I've had:

The Quaker (Chicken version) - Delicious. They make their chicken steaks with the chunky chicken, which I like much more than the shredded version. They could season the chicken more, but the cheese was melted perfectly and the veggies were fresh.

I would definitely recommend Planet Fitness to anyone looking for a cheap and convenient gym to go to. It's open 24 hours, which is great, and the staff are always polite and helpful. The only downside is that there isn't much motivation since there aren't many bodybuilders that go there, mostly just big women. But overall, it's a great gym for a great price.

I was very disappointed when we went to eat at 2:15 on Saturday and were told the kitchen closed at 2. Their website says: Sat & Sun all day. Their website claims that they are open until 5.

I'm always a bit suspect of places that can't manage simple details like their hours on their website. It makes me wonder about the awareness to quality and other "small" items. This place clearly can't be bothered to keep their website up to date, so I wouldn't trust them with anything else.

If you're looking for a great company to take care of your HVAC needs, look no further than these guys! They do great work, always meet their deadlines, and stand behind their work with a warranty. I couldn't recommend them more!

If you're looking for amazing food and great service, look no further than this restaurant! I eat here at least 2 times a week and have never been disappointed. The servers are always friendly and the food is delicious. I always leave with a full stomach!

This is a must-go restaurant in Reno! The food was fantastic - my wife had the tri-tip salad and I had the tri/tip/chicken combo. The sides were also very good - we shared the lemon meringue for dessert and it was delicious. The prices were reasonable for the quality of food and the experience. We will definitely be back!

Rebecca is an amazing nanny and an even better doula! She was always easy to talk to and her information and suggestions were always on point. She has a true passion for what she does and it shows in her work. I would highly recommend her to anyone looking for a doula!

I recently had my car tinted by Orange Tint and Tune and had fantastic service. Carlos, my technician, went over all the tint options with me and even adjusted the grade of the tint after I expressed the look that I was trying to achieve. That's the kind of customer care that deserves 5 stars. In addition, the receptionist was very pleasant and the owner Dustin even followed up to see how my service was.

Overall, I had a pleasant stay at this hotel. It's conveniently located near the airport, and the rooms are standard TownePlace Suite rooms with a refrigerator, stove, etc. The staff is friendly and helpful. The only downside is that the food and drink at the evening reception go quickly, so get there early!

This place is a great find! We were looking for somewhere to eat that wasn't a chain restaurant, and Yelp led us here. We're glad we made the trip!

The steaks here are amazing. They're grilled over oak and citrus wood, and the smoky flavor is incredible. We're big fans of smoking our own steaks at home, so it's rare to find a place that cooks them this way. The sides were also great - veggies and sweet potatoes.

The best part, though, was the wine. It was reasonably priced, and they had a great selection. Most of the bottles were under $20. You don't find that at most places - they mark up the prices 5x as much!

Our waitress, Lisa, was also great. She made great recommendations and her service was welcoming, friendly, and excellent.

We're definitely bookmarking this place for a return trip next time we're in Tampa. If

I'm so glad the owner of this location reached out to me after my previous review! We had a great conversation and I could tell he's really passionate about his business. I've been back a few times since then and the service has improved drastically. The new summer salads are amazing - definitely worth a try!

If you're looking for an amazing deli experience, look no further than this place! The Muffalata is huge and so delicious, and the live music on Saturday and Thursday nights is a great touch. The special is always a good choice, and there are plenty of sides to choose from. The chili, potato salad, and chips are all great. Definitely check this place out!

This was an amazing tour! Our guide, Carolyn, was so enthusiastic and passionate about her studies on the saguaro. She was also very knowledgeable. I would definitely recommend both the tour and Carolyn.

If you're looking for some good food in a not-so-great location, then this is the place for you. The lemon pepper wings are amazing, and there's a huge variety of flavors to choose from. The watermelon drink is delicious and definitely worth trying. The downside is that the location isn't the best, but they're trying to improve the community. Overall, this is a great place to eat, and you might even see Skip!

I love Tom Jones! It's a great place to take the family for a good, cheap meal. The blue ribbon is only $3.79 and it comes with pancakes, eggs, toast, sausage, bacon, juice, and coffee. I ate here with my kids and everyone got something they liked. The service is always fast and the waitresses are always friendly. I highly recommend Tom Jones!

I am an amateur athlete, and I first met Dr. Ferrel when I was playing softball. I was severely injured during the game, and he treated me on the field by relocating my ankle. He then told me to come to his office for treatment, but I told him I couldn't afford it as a single mom on a teacher's salary. Instead, I saw a physician. The physician said it would be months before I would be able to play again, but I was depressed and without much hope. I reached out to Dr. Ferrel again, and he did treat me as he promised. Not only did he treat me, but he healed me within weeks instead of months. Over the years, Dr. Ferrel has worked on me with amazing results each time. He will always be my hero.
If you're looking for a good time and some good food at a fair price, this is the place to go. The shows are always fun and the atmosphere is relaxed and entertaining.
. That's all you need to know. In-N-Out is the best burger place hands down. The fries are bomb too.

Cindy's is the best! The food is authentic and the staff is so friendly. Everything is made fresh and you can taste the difference from other Mexican restaurants at first bite. I would recommend this place to anyone that enjoys Mexican cuisine.

I stopped in at Trust Me BBQ for lunch today and I have to say that I was pretty disappointed. I've been wanting to try this place for over a year now, and finally stopped in about 3 months ago. I waited in line for 10 minutes with no service and left. After reading reviews, I figured I'd give it a chance again just to see what all the fuss is about. The food was 50/50 but the service was horrible so I'll likely never return.

The gentleman behind the counter didn't speak, smile or engage with us at all, I felt like I was at a vending machine. Once we finally ordered, he didn't even listen to the order and put the wrong sides in our meals, we had to correct him while he was serving. All in all, I will just stick with Down to the Bone BBQ.
This little hole in the wall is excellent! The pa nang chicken was great - I ordered one star spicy and it came quick. I will definitely return.

If you're looking for a great place to celebrate Cinco de Mayo, look no further than this place! They know how to mix different flavors to create unique dishes, and the margaritas and sangria are definitely worth trying. The wine bar they just opened is also a great spot to check out.

This small little donut bakery is located in one of Hermitage's oldest shopping centers! The owner, Yeu, serves not only your common popular donuts, but he also serves donuts with bacon on top, apple fritters, pigs in a blanket, breakfast pastries, and kolaches. In addition to these yummy treats, he makes doughssants - a scandalous marriage of a donut and a croissant. Prices are considerably cheap, with doughssants only $1.99 each and regular donuts about $.60 each. These sweet donuts are my favorite treats to buy for my kid's school teachers, and they love them! Coffee is also served here.

If you're looking for a good time, you'll find it here! We've been to a few different events at this arena and have had a blast each time. The concerts and basketball games we've attended have all been a lot of fun, and the food is really good too. They offer a lot of local favorites.
This place is excellent! We tried three appetizers and five entries and all of them were a hit. This prices are reasonable and the service is good. I'd go back again and again.

The service here has gone down. We used to go here a lot but now we go to another one. The service was slow and forgotten about. We had to ask for things multiple times and it felt like they were trying to rush us out.

Hands down the worst chicken and rice plate I've ever had. When I ordered I was told there was no sauce on the chicken (as I wanted, healthy). I ordered to go, by the time I reached the car the bag was full of oil spilling out of the container. There was easily 5-7 tablespoons of oil on the dish. Not what I was told and not what anyone would ever want to eat. Horrible. Their slogan even has the word healthy in it. What a joke.

I had a great experience purchasing a washer and dryer from Sears. I just bought a new home and needed all new appliances. I'm so glad I decided to go to Sears even though the reviews were not great. There was an excellent selection, knowledgeable salespeople, and timely delivery. The level of service we received was beyond expected! I really felt like they were working hard to give me the best price and offered many options to stay in my budget. They even took the time to check if there were any additional sales prices or discounts they could offer me. I was given honest feedback and all of my questions were answered. I am very happy with Sears and I would highly recommend!

If you're looking for a great meal that won't break the bank, this is the place for you. The food here is fantastic, and the staff is always so friendly and accommodating. I highly recommend this spot for a quick bite or a leisurely meal.

I finally got to try the new and improved Philly's Best! Wow, they did a great job with the remodel. I loved the mushroom cheese steak. The steak was cooked perfectly and the mushrooms added a great flavor. The cheese was melted perfectly and the bun was soft and fresh. Overall, a great experience!

If you're looking for a great cup of espresso and a chill place to hang out, this is the spot for you. The staff is always friendly and the bathrooms are clean - what more could you ask for? Just be aware that there are no outlets to charge your devices.
I will not be back, not worth it.

If you're looking for an amazing burger and don't mind spending a little extra, the Whiskey Burger from Village Whiskey is definitely worth trying. The burger is extremely tender and the bacon is delicious. The Duck Fat fries are also a great accompaniment. Just be warned that the portions are pretty big, so come hungry!

The food at this restaurant is amazing! The orange chicken is the best I've had in a long time, and the rest of the food was hot and delicious. It was worth spending $80 on food for my family, and now this will be our go-to spot for Asian food!

I was so happy to find this laundromat! It's clean, well-lit, and the staff is friendly and helpful. I was amazed at the speed of the laundry and dryer. I completed 4 oversize loads (probably equal to 8 regular loads) in just under 2 hours!

This place has security cameras, flat screen TVs, magazines, Wi-Fi, clean bathrooms, vending machines. It's a wonderful atmosphere to do your laundry. It wasn't overly busy, there are plenty of washers and dryers. I highly recommend this place!

If you're looking for a late night dinner option and don't mind spending a little extra, this place is worth checking out. The garlic bread is delicious and the food is good. Just be aware that the portions are small, so you may want to consider ordering a few plates to share.
The Haven is a great place to stop by for a burger during a Seahawks/Saints game. The burger I ordered was fantastic. The place was packed, but it was worth it. I will definitely be back!
The service is friendly and the place is always clean. I can't comment on the Pho because I've never had it, but I would recommend the vermicelli bowls.

I had the Chicken Marsala recommended by our waiter. The chicken was very thin, tough, and dry. The pasta was under cooked and stuck together. There was absolutely no flavor. My friend ordered the lasagne and did not like it all. There was only a thin layer of pasta and no flavor. My other friend was still eating her dinner and they cleared her plate when she went to the restroom, after she told the waiter she was not finished. They did bring her a new meal in a doggie bag. The positives are a Great atmosphere and live music. I enjoyed dancing with my husband. However, very expensive for awful food.

I was really disappointed in the food at this restaurant. The chicken marsala was dry and flavorless, and the pasta was undercooked. My friend's lasagna was also very disappointing - there was barely any pasta and no flavor. And my other friend's plate was cleared while she was in the restroom, even though she told

This place is a gem! Attractive space, great location near Broad Street line, plenty on street parking. BYOB. I've been twice and enjoyed every dish. Highlights were the chaats, beef short ribs, lamb vindaloo, beet salad, breads/pickles, and chai. We got the chocolate cake for the table to share each time and everyone loved it. Can get takeout beer at the corner bar. We'll be back!

This is my favorite restaurant! I always order their ceviche, which is delicious. The atmosphere is fun, and the service is great. Alex was our server, and he was friendly, attentive and thoughtful. He made sure our drinks were refilled and that we had everything we needed. The ceviche was fresh and flavorful, and the perfect start to our meal. We will definitely be back!

!

I absolutely love this store! They have a great salad bar with fresh ingredients, and they also have a wide variety of ethnic foods to try. I highly recommend this store to anyone looking for a great grocery experience.

The Mediterranean chicken shawarma at this restaurant is delicious! The chicken is cooked perfectly and is very juicy. The flavor is fantastic, and the pita is nice and fluffy. They were also very generous with the amount of chicken in the pita. The food was ready to go when I arrived, and the service was great. I would definitely come back here the next time I'm in the area.

If you're looking for a great vegetarian restaurant with delicious food and a pleasant atmosphere, look no further than this place. The staff are friendly and accommodating, and the space is comfortable and inviting. I highly recommend it for both vegetarians and non-vegetarians.

If you're looking for some good gumbo and want to be in the heart of Bourbon Street, then this is the place for you! The chicken & waffles were both delicious, and the staff was friendly. However, it did take a while to get actual service. Overall, a great experience!

If you're looking for a good, quick sandwich at the airport, Earl is a great option. They have a variety of options, including roast beef, which is my personal favorite. The roast beef is cooked well and has a great horseradish sauce that really kicks up the flavor. The portion size is also generous, so you won't be left feeling hungry. Plus, it's conveniently located near the security checkpoint and the Delta SkyClub, so you can easily grab it before your flight.

This place is amazing! The food and service were both fantastic. We started with an appetizer of cheese curds served with red pepper jelly and it was delicious. I ordered the fish tacos and my wife ordered a beer brat for dinner and we both loved our meals. The portions were huge and the price was great for the portion size. Our server was attentive and very knowledgeable about the menu. The manager stopped by and asked how everything was and I told him I had found a new cool place to hang out, have a beer and watch football. He said they have great deals on game days and told us about their brunch on the weekends. Everyone said goodbye as we walked out and reminded us to grab a rootbeer candy on our way out. I will definitely be back!

If you're looking for a delicious burger and a great beer selection, this is the place for you! The wait staff is friendly and welcoming, and the food comes out quickly. The atmosphere is pleasant and the restrooms are clean. I'll definitely be back!
It would be worth it to me to not have to deal with the hassle of this place.

Overall, a great experience with some delicious food!

I had a great time at Ava! The Ricotta cheese & toasted bread was a great appetizer, even though the bread to cheese ratio was a little off. The sausage and potato pizza was really good, but I think they forgot the Rosemary. The grouper w/Israeli couscous was scrumptious! The zeppoles were amazing, but the cherry tart was just okay. I'm definitely going to come back and try some of the other great-looking menu items!
I had a great experience at this restaurant! The sushi was fresh and delicious, and the service was wonderful. I will definitely be back!
This place is just the best. The chicken is really good and the fried corn on the cobs is awesome. I would definitely recommend this place to anyone.

If you're looking for a disappointing dining experience, look no further than Pancake Pantry! The pancakes taste like they came from a frozen, processed box, the "homemade" maple syrup is watery and full of fake flavoring, and the hash browns are greasy and tasteless. The bacon is overcooked and hard to chew. Obviously, this is a place that is living on its outdated reputation and there are much better options in Nashville.

This place is excellent! I went there for lunch and the budget option was very tempting. My wife had the prime rib po'boy with the soup of the day (tomato fennel) and both were excellent. The po'boy was an upscale interpretation with gruyere and a really good horseradish sauce. I had the seafood jambalaya and seafood gumbo which were both excellent. This is probably the best gumbo I've had.

They were professional, their expertise was obvious, and their arrangements were beautiful. Our guests raved about them, even days after the event was over. I was also able to take home/give away the arrangements, which is not always the case with other florists. And the flowers lasted several days after the event.

This place is great! The server immediately welcomed us and asked about our drink preferences. He was very knowledgeable and helpful. The beer selection was wonderful, the liquor selection divine. The bar food, even though it was a small selection, was excellent. I had never wanted to try pork bellies (the name turned me off.) Dan ordered it, I tried it, and we now have a convert. We highly recommend their pork belly sliders! I hope they continue to add a few more delicious tapas. These folks have it together and are very engaging. We'll be back often.

If you're looking for an average burger at an above average price, then this is the place for you. However, if you're expecting anything special, you'll likely be disappointed. The burgers are good, but nothing to write home about, and the fries are nothing to write home about either. The iced tea was also just average. Overall, it's a decent place to eat, but it's definitely overpriced.

I give this place one star only because our server, LaToya, was awesome. Other than that, the black bean burger was dry and the sweet potato fries were good. 

Today, while at lunch with a group of colleagues, the most disturbing thing happened. I noticed the manager in a green sweater lingering around the entrance and then two cop cars with lights flashing pulled up and 3 officers rushed in. They walked to the table next to us that the manager was pointing to and one of the officer's proceeded to pull out their handcuffs and tell the guy delivering food to put food down at the table and hands behind his back. They escorted him near the front door and had him sit down for a moment before taking him outside in freeZing cold with no jacket where he stood for a few minutes while cops came in and out of restaurant. 

This entire thing was poorly handled, disturbing and unsettling not only to the customers but the other staff. They should have

The sliders at this restaurant are fantastic! They're the perfect size so you can try more than one. The fried chicken slider, BLT slider, monte cristo and Cuban were all fantastic! The donuts to go are also great!

The food here is pretty good, especially for the price. I got the Carne Asada plate and it came with rice and beans, but they let me substitute the rice and beans for a salad. The steak was cooked pretty well. The service here is also good and attentive. I'm not sure what the specials are every day, but they seem to be pretty reasonable. Overall, this is a great place to eat.

I absolutely love this little shop! The spices wafting from it are so inviting, and they have such a large variety of spices that you can smell, taste a little, and purchase. The staff is knowledgeable and more than happy to assist you in finding the right spice you need for all your cooking needs. The prices are reasonable and the products last a long time. I highly recommend this shop to anyone looking for a great selection of spices!

If you're a tennis player, this is the place to go! Steve and his partner are the best, and they have a great selection of demo racquets to choose from. Prices are very reasonable, and they're always willing to help you find the right gear.

I was really surprised at how packed it was when we got there around 6pm. I knew it would be busy, but the line went all the way out the door! The staff was amazing though and we only waited in line for about 8 minutes. We found a table and our food was there in less than 5 minutes. Even with the amount of people they had, it ran so smoothly. One of my sandwiches was messed up but it was very loud in there so I don't think she heard me correctly. But someone came to our table and had a new, correct sandwich almost immediately. I love that they made time to go around asking if we needed refills and how the food was. So glad to have a Chick-fil-A in Reno! They upheld the Chick-fil-A standards even with all the chaos of opening day.

time

This is a great spot for wine tasting! The wines are all great, and the prices are great too. The service is top-notch, and I had a great time.

Beck's is a great place to go for some good old fashioned Louisiana cooking. The portions may be a bit small, but the gumbo more than makes up for it. The chicken alfredo was just okay, but if you're looking for some good gumbo, Beck's is the place to go.
I was a little worried about seeing the reviews but everything was great! Not long wait time. Staff was nice from walking in the lobby and asking which way to the office, to the office staff.
Hipsters unite! The Taint is the place to be if you're looking for a good time. The staff is friendly and the clientele is top-notch. I highly recommend this place to anyone looking for a good time.
"We're glad to be here!"

This is a great little spot on Germantown Ave. They have a great selection of cookies and bars, as well as a "cake scrapple" that is a must-try. The Red Velvet cake with cream cheese frosting is my favorite, but the M&M cookie is also great. The bench outside is the perfect spot to enjoy your treats.

This place has really improved! The environment is much more comfortable now, and there have been lots of other great changes. The only downside is that the chairs could be a bit more comfortable - it would be nice to be able to sit through an entire football game without getting too sore.

If you're in the mood for some good fast food, this is the place to go. The food is delicious, but the service is slow. I think they need 1 or 2 more people up front when placing an order if you're waiting and not using the kiosk to order.

.

I went to Cajun Seafood when they first opened and wasn't impressed. They only had one flavor and it wasn't great. Everything was overpriced and we left feeling hungry. It's not Cajun style seafood. The sauce tastes like a mixture of buffet style sauces with fish sauce. There are better places to eat.

If you're looking for a fun, informative way to spend a few hours in Ybor City, this walking tour is a great option! Our guide Raymond was knowledgeable and friendly, and we learned a lot about the history and culture of the area. The food tastings were a highlight for me - everything was delicious, but the Cuban sandwich from Stone Soup Company was especially good. I would recommend this tour to anyone, whether you're a visitor to Tampa or a lifelong resident. Just be prepared to rack up a few steps on your Fitbit - we hit over 5,000 during our tour!

If you're looking for a delicious slice of pizza, you can't go wrong with Franzone's. The sweet spiral plain pies are my personal favorite, but the white pizza with onions is also a great option. The onions add a nice touch to the pizza and it's just as good as the Franzone's I grew up with in Bridgeport.

I would not recommend this clinic to anyone. My daughter had a severe sore throat and we saw another fast clinic in a CVS a few days earlier. The staff were very robotic in their behavior and it felt like I was being hurried out the door. There were no other patients in the facility during our visit and I was confused about the wait time and gruff behavior. The experience was very unfriendly.

If you're looking for a great chicken sandwich in an industrial area, this is the place to go! The chicken sandwich was phenomenal, and the overall food was great. I would definitely recommend this place to anyone in the area.

I had a great time on my tour with Matt! The online appointment process was very simple, and the ride was great. We had a four-seater and got to see some amazing views. Matt was a great guide and very informative. I would definitely recommend this tour to anyone looking for a great time.
