If you're looking for a great bar with amazing happy hour deals, look no further than this place! Wine and drafts are only $3, and you can get a delicious pizza for only $5. The to-go dinners and lunches are also very reasonably priced and ready in no time. But the best part of this establishment are the staff - they are some of the friendliest people you'll ever meet!

I had a horrible experience here. The waiter was great but as I got my appetizer, there was it has a hair in it. Next the noodles came out mine was fine but my friend has a huge hair in his. I thought he was joking until he told me. After that it ruined my appetite, I gave the noodles back and they didn't even give me a new one, I thought I should've got the food for free at that point.. never eating here again

If you're looking for an amazing dining experience that won't break the bank, ITV is the place for you. The small, dimly-lit dining room is beautiful and intimate, and the staff is incredibly friendly and welcoming. The food is absolutely incredible - I highly recommend the Foie gras with Apricot Miso, Pork Cheeks with vegetables, and Trout Pumpernickel Soldiers. The cocktails are also some of the best I've ever had - definitely try the Ouroboros. Trust me, you won't be disappointed!
The staff is wonderful and the treatments are top notch. I highly recommend this place!

If you're looking for the best pizza around, Buckingham Pizza is the place to go. The plain pizza is my favorite, but a few of the specialities are also worth trying - the cool ranch pizza is my favorite. This is a pizza parlor, so don't get fancy - just order the pizzas and maybe some sides. While some of the entrees are good (chicken piccata), stick with the pizza and you'll love it.

If you're looking for a great iced latte and beignet in New Orleans, look no further than Cafe Beignet! The live music creates a great atmosphere, and the service is top-notch. We also visited Cafe du Monde, but in our opinion Cafe Beignet is much better. There are hardly ever lines, so you can enjoy your meal without having to wait.

If you're looking for a fun, no-frills atmosphere right on the water, Captain Bill's is the place for you. You can watch passersby and dolphins alike while enjoying great food and accommodating service.

Our dining party ranged from a picky 7 year old to two 40-somethings and a 72-year-old grandmother, and Captain Bill's had menu choices for everyone. They even made some ingredient substitutions for us.

The food arrived hot, fresh, and exactly to our specifications. Wait service and wait time were both excellent, and we all left the restaurant satisfied and having enjoyed the experience. We'll be back to Captain Bill's next time we visit John's Pass. I hope you'll consider it too!

This restaurant is a must-visit if you find yourself near Valrico. The sushi is very good, and the peanut avocado roll is a must-try. The Volcano roll was also amazing. The service was great, very friendly customer service. I will definitely visit again even though it's far from where I live.

If you're looking for some decent Cuban food and happen to be near this place, it's worth checking out. Their specials change daily and are prepared fresh, so you can get a good meal for a reasonable price. Just don't expect anything amazing.

If you're looking for a nice, quiet place to have a good meal, this is the spot. My husband enjoyed his 6 oz pepperloin, and I had the shrimp kabob. Unfortunately, my shrimp were overcooked and quite small, but the service was good. Not a lot of people around, so it's perfect if you're looking to avoid a crowd.

The owner came out and introduced himself to us, and we chatted for a few minutes.  He was very personable and down to earth.

I would highly recommend this place, especially if you are looking for a great sandwich in a hurry.

The line was out the door, but I had a sandwich in my hands 7 minutes later. I'm guessing it took longer because I didn't know what I wanted right away. All the locals were running in, saying hi to the owner and ordering up their usual's. No place for a rookie, but they were extremely patient with us and a few others that wandered in not knowing what they were doing either.

As soon as you cross the threshold, you know you have made a good choice, the smell makes your mouth water. The Punk agreed so we decided to sit inside (everyone else was outside).

Typically, I would never ever order pastrami, but the menu said it was

Heather is a color wizard and a genius at crafting a look with flair just for you. She has created a shop vibe that is unstuffy, chill, and totally comfortable. I trust her and the staff she hires when I recommend friends and family, and love that she's made a home in the heart of E. Passyunk. Ask her for tips on caring for cactus houseplants, or chat about vintage bikes when you visit.

I'm pretty happy with Sally's. They have more options for hair supplies than any other beauty store in the area, which is great when I feel like experimenting with my hair. The staff is nice and friendly, too. The only downside is that the store could be bigger, brighter, and cleaner. The cramped aisles, dust bunnies, and flickering, yellow fluorescent lights don't exactly give that same "beauty/trendy" feeling that other beauty stores have. If I could give one piece of advice to management it would be to work on the appearance of the store. Other than that, though, I'm pretty happy with Sally's.

I highly recommend Rodney Mitchell Salon for your next cut or color.

I have been getting my hair cut by a guy in Austin for seven years, and he is that good. The couple of times that I've strayed, I have been severely disappointed in the outcome. But I wasn't planning a trip back to Austin for a while and badly needed a cut, so I decided to bite the bullet and try Rodney Mitchell Salon. I'm so glad I did!

My friend walks in a few weeks ago with *srsly* the cutest short hair cut. And so I ask her who and where, and she says Rodney Mitchell. I figured that this place would be too expensive, but she corrected my thinking on the matter. So I called to make an appointment with her guy (whose name I sadly cannot remember at the moment) and Rodney answered the phone. Turns out the guy my friend had seen didn't do morning appointments and all my afternoons

If you're looking for a place to get some work done or enjoy a good conversation, this is not the place for you. The music is way too loud and you can't get away from it. However, they do have gluten free goodies and yummy Italian sodas.
4/5 stars.

I was disappointed when I found out this place branched off from California. I was expecting the same great boba, but it just wasn't the same. The flavors didn't taste as natural as I'm used to, and the taro flavor was especially disappointing.

However, if you're not too concerned about natural vs powder flavor, then this place could be good for you. They ask what level you would like your sweetness and any additional add-ons you would like. I always get boba, but sometimes the grass jelly is pretty good too! I'd recommend you try.

This is also a good place to catch up, talk, play board games, and even do homework. I know it's always busy with students from the U of A, and being told from them it's a nice area to just hang out is a pretty good sign.

Maybe I'm just too picky, but I think it could be better.

I have been ordering from Silver Mine's at the same location for the last 4-5 years and they have only gotten progressively worse. Don't ask for anything to be added to your soup or chili; they'll charge you for the additions but will not include them in the order. They'll also most likely to include the free side such as the bread. It literally takes at least an hour to get your food delivered, maybe they should call Jimmy Johns and ask the what their secret is. This business is in major trouble with all of the other options available. The service is worse than if you had a bunch of kindergarteners running the business, at least they would be nice. You guys are right next to Eller Business School, why don't you ask them how you can improve??? Currently, this place is an embarrassment to their industry, and a waste of space on University Blvd. NEVER ORDERING FROM THIS PLACE AGAIN.

I bought my beautiful new bike from this shop a few weeks ago and promptly crashed it (curse you, trolley tracks!). I brought it back to the shop this afternoon to see if there was any way they could try to fix the front basket, which was pretty mangled, and to give the bike a once-over to make sure it was safe to ride. I was expecting to have to leave the bike with them for a few days, but the whole process took less than a half hour. Not only did they fix the basket (not perfect, but pretty damn close), but they also fixed the gear shifter that was a little out of whack... FOR FREE. I couldn't believe it.

I also want to note that everyone in the shop- from the owners, to the sales people on the floor, to the mechanics, to the dog that greets you at the door- is so friendly and welcoming. I am so happy I found them.
If you're looking for a place to blow your entire paycheck in one go, look no further than this place! The prices are sky-high, but the store is like a Disneyland for adults. I absolutely loved it!

Pag's is a great spot for a casual burger and a beer. The burgers are delicious and cooked to perfection. The staff is friendly and accommodating. The ambiance is perfect for a night out with friends.

If you're looking for amazing Indian food at reasonable prices, this is the place for you! The service is wonderful and the staff is always willing to help. The Indian Pancake and Hainanese Chicken are my personal favorites, but everything on the menu is delicious. I highly recommend this restaurant!

If you're looking for a waterfront diner with good food but terrible service, this is the place for you! The waitresses are slow and unkind, and the floor of the outside deck is covered in trash. I had to stand up several times to grab straw wrappers and napkins before they blew into the water. If you're going to have a business on the water, be responsible about it. The food was good but I won't be back.

I recently had the pre fixe meal for $22 and I enjoyed the combination of tastes on my plate. The chicken was moist my veggies were tasty but a little too greasy....overall is was a great meal. I would definitely recommend this place to anyone looking for a good meal at a reasonable price.

If you're looking for a quick, cheap lunch, this place is a decent option. The food is your standard Chinese fare, but it's always ready when you go to pick it up. They have some good lunch specials, too.

I finally got to eat at this restaurant last night, and I was not disappointed. The menu is very eclectic and there is something for everyone. I had the onion tart as an appetizer and it was delicious. My husband had the veal meatballs with sauce on polenta and he said it was very good. The red gravy tasted like my own. We both ordered the special of citrus short ribs with fat noodles and brussel sprouts, peas. We couldn't finish it all, but we will definitely be back to try other interesting items. The atmosphere is small and crowded but very friendly.

If you're looking for a truly authentic Italian dining experience, look no further than Angelina's! From the moment you walk in, you'll feel right at home. Angelina is cooking in the front of the restaurant and her husband is servicing, and you can tell they're passionate about what they do. We ordered the eggplant and roasted pepper appetizer, veal osso bocca, carbonara, and lasagna, and everything was absolutely DELISH. Can't wait to go back!

If you're looking for a great meal with an even better view, look no further than this restaurant. The lobster mac and cheese is a must-try - it's creamy, cheesy, and full of delicious lobster meat. The view from the dining room is simply stunning, and it's the perfect place to enjoy a romantic dinner or a night out with friends.
This ice cream store is super tasty and has enormous portions. Some unique flavors too. Not much else to say but an amazing ice cream store that others should try to emulate.

If you're looking for a place to drink on a Friday night, don't bother with this place. The drink specials are great, but it's never crowded and they always seem to be closing early. Last time I was there, it was 10 pm on a Friday night, and they announced last call at 10:15. We left and went to a different bar in the area.

If you're looking for a place to order from when you're feeling those late night munchies, this is the place to go! They have a great selection of food to choose from, so you're sure to find something to satisfy your cravings. Plus, the delivery is always fast and reliable, so you won't have to wait long for your food to arrive.

I found a few modern pieces here, but the prices were way too high for the quality of furniture. I also didn't appreciate the staff hanging out and chatting in the middle of the store rather than helping customers. The "clearance" section was also a joke. I would recommend shopping around town or waiting for a holiday sale if you find something you must have from this store.

If you're looking for a great pizza place with an even better atmosphere, Franzone's is the place for you! The owner is always around and is super friendly, which makes the experience that much better. The pizza is delicious, and even though I'm not a fan of sweet sauce, they do a great cheesesteak as well. The fries are also a must-try! Overall, Franzone's is a great place with great food, and I would definitely recommend it to anyone.

Bab Cafe is a fantastic new addition to the Reno culinary scene. With delicious, fresh food and a knowledgeable staff, it's a great place to get a quick, tasty meal. The Jeyuk Top-Bab is a must-try - the flavor is incredible! The sauce bar is a great way to customize your meal, and the included miso soup is a nice bonus. The downtown location is convenient for take-out, dining in, or delivery via UberEats.

This was my first meal in New Orleans, and I have to say I was impressed! I ordered the $15 lunch special, a seafood stew with oyster meat, crab claws, shrimp, and redfish. It came with a salad, and I was surprised at how good it was. I'm not even a fan of seafood, but this stew was so good that I ate the whole thing. The spice, consistency, and tenderness of the meat were all perfect. If you're in New Orleans, this is definitely a meal worth trying!

If you don't mind waiting a little while for your food, Biscuit Love is totally worth it! I had the vegan grits with a biscuit on the side and it was amazing. My sisters all enjoyed their choices as well. Just be warned that the bloody Marys are spicy! The service was excellent, especially considering the 45-minute wait. The line moved fast and then there was no long wait for our food. They have their process perfected! Thanks Biscuit Love for a delicious breakfast!
Overall, I really enjoyed my experience here and I would definitely recommend it to others.
This bakery is amazing! The breakfast sandwiches are great, the coffee is delicious, and the donuts are to die for. My friend and I love coming here on weekend mornings.

If you're looking for a great place to enjoy some whiskey or bourbon, this is the spot for you. They have a great selection to suit anyone's taste, and the burgers are some of the best I've ever had. The duck fries are a must-try, and the atmosphere is cute and cozy. However, if you're coming with a group, be aware that the seating can be a bit awkward and make it difficult to have conversation with everyone at your table. Overall, though, this is a great place and we'll definitely be back.

If you're looking for a cozy English pub in the heart of the city, this is the place for you. The bartenders are knowledgeable and make great drinks. However, the prices are a bit high and the seating is limited.
This is a cozy spot for drinks with friends, but the drink choices are limited and the food is very sweet. The servers are nice and leave you alone unless you need something.
This place is the best! Every year they have hayrides, pumpkin picking, and lots of other activities. They always deliver on a great experience.

If you own a high-end vehicle, don't even think about taking it to this dealership for service. You will be expected to pay for a loaner car, even if the work is covered under warranty. The staff is unaccommodating and unprofessional. Take your business elsewhere.

If you're looking for a smaller version of Whole Foods, this is the place for you! They have a salad bar, fresh fruits, a juice bar, and all sorts of other great stuff. The parking lot is a great bonus, and it's just a couple blocks from clothing stores.

I absolutely love coming here! Great outdoor place with a wine selection you can't find anywhere else (not your typical wines you find in the grocery). The live music today was fabulous - and on a Thursday afternoon! Come here, get a few cheeses and wine and you will be satisfied. Oh, and the regular menu is crafty and artistic. It's a beautiful place with ambiance and on the palate.
This place is great for smog checks! The service is quick and the staff is friendly. I would definitely recommend this place to anyone.

I absolutely loved this restaurant! They have great gluten-free and vegan options, which is awesome for me since I have dietary restrictions. The salad, pizza, and root beer were all perfect. The service was outstanding, and I will definitely be back soon!
This is a great burger spot! The burgers are delicious and the sweet potato tots are a must. The place is very clean and nice. My group of 6 were all very satisfied.

.2

I had a great experience at this restaurant! The food was pretty good, and the lighting and noise were perfect. The environment was also great. The only thing that could have been better was the staff. They were friendly and helpful, but they could have been more attentive.

If you're looking for a quick, delicious sandwich near the water, this is the place for you! The Cuban press is my favorite, but the breakfast sandwich is also great. The setting is pretty basic, but the food more than makes up for it.

I'm so glad I gave this place a second chance! The food was even better than I remembered, and they seem to have worked out the kinks from the grand opening. The portion size of the garlic noodles has improved, and we had no problem getting a table on a Saturday evening. I'm looking forward to my next visit!

I love Skyline Chili. I first had this stuff in Cincinnati, and I was thrilled when a location opened in Clearwater. This particular Skyline, however, is not great. The service is generally poor, and the food comes out very slowly. It seems like every time that I go, they are "out" of something, or some equipment isn't working. Sometimes it's baked potatoes, sometimes it is french fries, sometimes it is something else. Love the cheese coney hot dogs all the way! I hope this location can get their act together.
The eyebrow waxing here is fantastic, but not worth the hassle.
The tacos, nachos, atmosphere, and margaritas are all great at this place! Wednesday is a triple special day, so it's a great day to go!

I don't think they have enough staffs here. Always you can see customers waiting. It took them about an hour and more to have my car ready. Even worse, in the next morning before I was gonna take my family out for a trip, I found my car had no wiper fluid; hence I had no choice but went back and waste another hour waiting them to refill it.

The car was not thorough cleaned (either outside or inside). I rent the car on May 18th, extremely close to my 25th birthday (June 6th), and still, I was still charged for underage fee, which is extremely expensive -- $20 BEFORE TAX PER DAY. There was just no way to waive it. I should have gone for, and I will recommend others in the future to find another rental company such as Hertz, at which you can always find codes to waive this crazy fee.

The last thing is DO NOT buy the fuel option. Although

Thanks yelp reviewers! You didn't let me down! I just had Todd and Roberta over to clean my carpets and couch and they did an amazing job! All the spots where my dog had accidents are gone and everything smells fresh. I was really impressed with how dry everything was so soon after they finished. They were also really nice and gave me a lot of tips on how to care for my home. I would definitely recommend them to anyone and will be using them again in the future!

If you're looking for a great place to get your coffee fix, look no further than Love it Here! Their sips mocha is my go-to and the staff has always been so nice. I absolutely love that they have a drive thru too, which helps when I don't want to unload my kiddos. And their cakes are amazing too!

I have been a fan of Chateau La Vin for a few years. It has been fun to watch the place evolve. At first it was more of a wine store with only a few tables. Now it has been transformed into a wine bar. He offers cheese and crackers and people order from the local restaurants and some of them even deliver. He had two guys playing music. He offers so many different wines and is willing to share his knowledge. My friend is a beer drinker and he has a nice variety for them as well. He does have a few tables out in front. This is a great place to go and relax.

The Hollander Hotel is a beautiful, historic hotel located in the heart of downtown St. Petersburg, Florida. We were thrilled to use the Hollander for our wedding hotel and had an absolutely incredible experience. The staff was incredibly accommodating and went above and beyond to make sure that our guests felt at home. The rooms are clean, cozy, and reasonably priced. The Tap Room is a great place to gather with friends, and the brunch on the patio is not to be missed! We will definitely be returning for many more visits in the future.

If you're looking for a delicious, authentic gyro, this is not the place for you. The gyro "platter" was dry, uninspired, and nothing like a deconstructed gyro. Worst of all, it came with "vegetables" which looked more like poop. Tasted that way, too. There are better places in Fairmount for lunch, and they won't serve you poop, either.

If you're looking for a nice place to have some drinks and relax, this is the place for you. The brewery right there is a great touch, and the beer was good. The waiter was very knowledgable and kind, which made the experience even better.

If you're looking for an amazing dinner experience in New Orleans, look no further than this restaurant. Their BBQ shrimp and bread pudding are two of their signature dishes, and they did not disappoint. The ambience was great and the service was fantastic. I highly recommend this place if you're visiting New Orleans.
This store is great! They have an insane selection and the customer service is incredible. I wish they could come to Ft. McMurray.

I would not recommend this place to anyone! The staff is unprofessional and they try to scam you with their "coupons." I went in with a coupon that I found online for $15 for unlimited tanning for a week for first time customers. The lady behind the desk acted like she had no idea what I was talking about. Then I pulled up the coupon and she said it's only for students and that I needed a student ID. However the coupon said nothing about this. Then she switched to saying the coupon is expired, yet it's still on YELP and their website. She also said they won't honor the $75 for 45$ coupon you can literally purchase on yelp either. Just bullshit line after bullshit line. I then left And called creve coeur location and the lady there says, "yes you can still use that coupon, but you must go to the same location each time for that week once you choose a location." I knew

I was very impressed with this place! The food was amazing. Quick service chipotle style line ordering but with high-quality Indian food. Also the staff was super helpful in helping me decide what to get since I'm an Indian food newbie. Can't wait to eat there again!

I was pleasantly surprised by El Sabor Poblano! I was expecting your typical dive Mexican restaurant, but this place was great. The fish tacos were my favorite - they were huge and had no fishy taste. The chorizo was also really good. The staff was friendly and accommodating. I would definitely recommend this place - it's a great find in South Philly!

I had a great time at this bar, even though it was during an investigation of a burglary! The bartender was great and service was prompt. I ordered a pint of dark ale and my buddy and I split a order of wings. The beer was cold and the wings were very tasty. I met the owners of the establishment at the last Italian Fest at the Farmers Market and they were very friendly, so I really wanted to like this place. I will continue to patronize this spot as it was a great spot close to home and work. I also like the locally non franchised making it work attitude that this place gives. I really was very comfortable at this establishment and I'll tell the rest of fellow Yelpers to hit this spot!!!

This place is great! The reviews on Yelp are spot on - the sandwiches are delicious and the service is fast and friendly. We waited about 15 minutes in line, ordered 4 different sandwiches, filled up our sodas, walked out to our table, and our sandwiches were delivered to us as we say down. We enjoyed our meal and would definitely recommend this place to others.

If you're looking for a comfortable movie-going experience, this is the place for you. The recliners are top-notch, and the bartender at the lounge next to the theaters is very friendly. However, the concessions stand could use some work. On a busy Saturday night, there were only a handful of employees working the counter, and they didn't seem to be very organized. The popcorn was also burnt. Next time, I'll eat before I come and just stick to the bar.
This is one of the best hotels I have ever stayed at. The staff is clean, polite, and the pool and entrance are both grand. I can't wait until next year to come back!

If you enjoy terrible food and terrible service, then this is the place for you! I went here when it first opened, and have never desired to go back again. I was so very disappointed at the quality and the taste of the food. I would absolutely not recommend dining here.

I went to this brewery on a Sunday afternoon and there were only a handful of people there. We sat at the bar and were greeted by a bartender who started by telling us they were out of most food items. No worries, we just wanted a couple of beers. We sampled several varieties, all of which were average. Nothing memorable about any of the six styles we tried.

Unfortunately, the staff was in a snit because their relief was late. I get it, but they were having a full blown discussion behind the bar which all patrons could hear. Kind of put a damper on things.

Cool location and cool place, but not sure we would go back based on this visit as there are better options near by.

If you're looking for a disappointing, overpriced sandwich, then Tony Luke's is the place for you! I was really looking forward to trying their Philly Cheese Steak, since I'm from Philly and all. But the sandwich I got bore no resemblance to the sandwich pictured on the overhead display. The meat was especially terrible - I don't know what dog food tastes like, but I'm pretty sure I just paid $10 for it. Save your money and go somewhere else.
This place is amazing! Best kept secret in Creve Couer. 9 hole course - affordable and staff is helpful. I absolutely love this place!
The service is slow and the employees have bad attitudes, but the food is good.

If you're looking for amazing food at a dive bar, then this is the place for you! The service is unfortunately not the best, but the food more than makes up for it. Everything I've had here has been absolutely delicious, and I always leave feeling satisfied.

If you're looking for a great art museum to visit in Indianapolis, look no further than the Indianapolis Museum of Art! This museum is absolutely beautiful, and best of all, it's free to enter! I was really impressed by the quality of the art on display, especially in the African Art and Modern Art sections. Just be sure not to take any pictures in the Modern Art section, as that's not allowed. The outdoor sculpture garden and gift shop are also definitely worth checking out. Highly recommended!
The service was good, and the manager was attentive. But I was really disappointed with the wait and the lack of sauerkraut.

The Shop is an amazing space! Their attention to detail and services are unbelievable. Plenty of places to have private meetings as well as post up and get work done. The staff is always willing to help and the space is just beautiful. I highly recommend this space to anyone looking for a place to work or meet!
This was an amazing anniversary dinner! The food was incredible and the service was top notch. We will definitely be back!

I was really disappointed with my experience at Terrace Lounge. The cocktails were weak and watery, and the bartenders didn't seem to know what they were doing. The service was also very spotty. I hated the people there - many of them were your typical casino gamblers. I much prefer Cin Cin, which has the best cocktails in town and no machines at the bar.

If you're looking for a great time and some delicious food, look no further than Amanda and her team! The service was wonderful and Amanda was a riot - she had us laughing the whole time. The food was top-notch and the beer was cold - what more could you ask for?

This is my favorite nail shop in the city. I've been going here for years. I enjoy the quiet serene atmosphere. The staff is very friendly and efficient. The price of $25.00 for a pedicure in the South. You can't beat it!

Thank you for a lovely morning! I was in NJ early and decided to stop in for a delicious diner breakfast. I got a taylor ham, egg, and cheese and a short stack of blueberry pancakes (I simply couldn't decide between sweet or savory, plus leftovers are never a bad thing).

The egg sandwich was fantastic. I was nervous when they said they didn't have kaiser rolls so I went with a hamburger roll. It was an excellent decision. The roll was excellent - not just an average cheap hamburger roll. They layered the cheese on the sandwich, which to me is a must for a true egg sandwich. It was served with home fries, which were sauteed with large slices of peppers and onions. I'm not the biggest breakfast potatoes fan, but these were great and I appreciated that they didn't clearly just scoop some food from a huge pile of pre-cooked home fries.

The pancakes were great and fluffy.

This place is a total ripoff. We paid $35 for the "piano guys" to sing a song to the birthday girl, and they sang an offensive, disgusting song that ruined the birthday. The sound system is terrible, too. Save your money and go somewhere else.

I really like the new Han Dynasty that took over the spot of the old Mid-Atlantic restaurant. I think the food is okay, but I love the service and atmosphere. I also love that I can ask for lunch portions during lunch time which are half the price of the regular menu items.

If you're looking for a delicious, authentic Spanish meal, Carisma Restaurante is the place for you! The food is fantastic, and the service is wonderful. Owner Jose is very friendly and makes sure to visit every table to ensure that everyone is happy with their meal. Tonight, we had the Paellas, salmon, and filet mignon, and everything was cooked to perfection and served hot. The family also has a cafe in front of the restaurant, and Jose gave us a tour and introduced us to his daughter, who runs the cafe. The baked goods and coffee at the cafe are just as good as the meals at Carisma. So if you're looking for a great meal and a great experience, be sure to check out Carisma Restaurante!

If you're looking for a little taste of Senegal and West Africa, this is the place to go. The food is delicious and the service is friendly. I highly recommend the Thiboudienne - the national dish of Senegal. They do a version without the usual tomato sauce, and it's absolutely amazing. I also took home a Jollof Rice, which is often called the mother dish of Jambalaya. It was delicious! There are a few hightop tables inside for dining or you can order the food to-go. Either way, you won't be disappointed.

If you're looking for a flavorless, extremely salty falafel wrap, this is the place for you! The falafels, pita, and tzatziki sauce were all lacking in flavor, except for the extreme saltiness. The only good part about the wrap were the fresh diced cucumber & tomato, but they were unfortunately hidden beneath the icky white sauce that doesn't even deserve to be called tzatziki. Save yourself the trouble and go somewhere else for a falafel wrap that actually tastes good.

This place is exactly what you need it to be - bougie and casual at the same time. Whether you're coming in with your Gucci bag or in your yoga pants, you can slam a delicious cocktail or three. I had a great time here and would definitely come back!

I'm really glad we decided to try this place out! The special we shared was a great way to sample a bunch of their different dishes. The chicken, steak, and rice/beans were all fantastic, and even the yuca wasn't bad. The plantains were my favorite though. I didn't try the salad, but it looked good too. If you're looking to try something new, definitely check this place out.

If you're looking for some good southern cooking, then you need to check out this place! The pulled pork was smoky and juicy, and the sweet potato casserole and red beans and rice were both delicious. The red beans and rice were a bit spicy, but that didn't take away from how good they were. Definitely worth a visit!

This place is amazing! I brought my car in because it was so dirty, I hadn't even washed it in months. They did an executive detailing job and now my car looks amazing. I would highly recommend this place to anyone!

If you're looking for a top-notch, full-service gym in the area, look no further than Lifetime Fitness! The staff is incredibly friendly and helpful, and the facilities are top-notch. The bathrooms are especially great - they're fully stocked with all the toiletries you could need. Highly recommend!

If you're looking for some decent barbecue, this place is worth checking out. The pulled pork was a little dry, but it had a nice smoky flavor. The green beans, Mac n cheese, and cornbread were all pretty average. The original bbq sauce is pretty sweet, so keep that in mind if you're not a fan of sweet sauces. I'll probably go back, but there are better options out there.

This place is not worth the wait. We made the mistake of coming here on a Lenten Friday and the wait was forever. The food was alright, but nothing special. The alligator was too greasy and the oysters were fresh but I only had 3 because I have a sensitive stomach. The entrees were also not great. My husband's roast beef was salty and my kabob was bland. For the price, there are better options out there.

If you're looking for an amazing Chinese restaurant in [city], look no further than this place! The food is always delicious and flavorful, and it's the perfect place to share a bunch of dishes with a large group. I haven't had a single bad experience here, and I know I'm not the only one - this place is always packed for a reason.
"The best sandwich I've ever had."
This place is so worth the wait! The crepes are amazing! I also loved the grits, which is rare. Tried my hubby's pancakes....awesome! This is definitely a must-go spot when you're in the area.

If you're looking for a burger and fries in a casual setting, this place is ok. But be prepared to wait a while for your food, and don't expect great service. The blue cheese burger was decent, but could have used less blue cheese. The fries and onion sticks were both good.

Overall, I would recommend this place if you're looking for a decent meal and are willing to spend a little more.  The guacamole and Mojito are worth it, but be aware of the parking situation.

3/5 stars

If you're looking for a waterfront dining experience in _______, the Rusty Pelican is the place to go. Just be sure to request a table by the window when you make your reservation, or you may end up like us and get stuck in the middle of the dining room! Our server Liz was great, and made up for the less-than-stellar experience we had with the hostess. The drinks and food were both excellent, so we'd definitely recommend this spot for a special night out.

I visited the Urban Wine Room on the pier and was really disappointed. The wine was average, and the staff was stingy with the benefits for wine club members. I would not recommend this winery to anyone.

I got a cheap haircut in NY for next to nothing and what do you know. it looks like some crazy chimp chewed up my hair and spat  it back on my raw scalp.

Since I'm going for job interviews, I needed to look better and went to Domenick's. The guys were great, Robert cut my hair and did a clean job. Bill came out to $35. I'd give it a 4, but it was a little pricy for my taste, but I look human again. Don't know what you guys in Philly normally pay for a haircut., just write something:

I got a cheap haircut in NY for next to nothing and what do you know. it looks like some crazy chimp chewed up my hair and spat  it back on my raw scalp.

Since I'm going for job interviews, I needed to look better and went to Domenick's. The guys were great, Robert cut my

I'm very unhappy with my experience at Monro Muffler. They underfilled my engine by 3 quarts of oil and caused damage to the engine. I brought it to Bergeys and they discovered the timing chain needed to be replaced. Joe the service associate that took the car in was extremely rude and unprofessional to my wife, and he told the insurance company as little as possible. I brought it to another mechanic who was able to help us prove more it was from the oil. So on top of losing a service customer, I'm on the market for a new car. I would not recommend Monro Muffler to anyone.

This shop is beautiful and clean, with amazing breakfast tarts and chicken pot pies. The sweets are all stunning and look delicious. I felt like some of the items were a bit pricey for their size, but I know that premium quality comes at a higher cost. The counter staff were friendly and engaging, which made the experience even better. I'll definitely be back and would recommend this shop to others.

If you don't mind waiting in line for a bit, the pancakes here are just fine. I got the sugar and spice pancakes and they were a bit dry, but my friends enjoyed their raspberry, sweet potato, and San Antonio pancakes. I don't understand all the hype around this place, but if the line isn't too long it's not a bad option for breakfast. If the line is longer, though, I'd recommend heading down the street to Fido for some insanely good coffee and great breakfast food.

If you're looking for good service, look elsewhere. Unfortunately, this is the most convenient Honda dealer for me, so I'm stuck with them for oil changes. The service advisors are terrible - Kelly and her team used to be good, but they're long gone. Avoid this place if you can.

This is the best soon-dubu in the city! The place is tucked away and once you walk in, it's like you've stepped into a Korean home. It's very welcoming, warm and inviting.

The soft tofu is stewed and put into the dol sot pots which each and every stew feels like it's custom made for you. You can select from beef, seafood or mixed meats (seafood & beef), mushroom, and just plain. They can adjust the spice as needed too. I always get the extra hot with the hot temperature, can't beat it. The rice also comes in a dol-sot which is great if you leave it in for a while, it burns the rice into a nice crispy shell.

Just thinking about this place makes my mouth salivate!

If you're not into tofu, they also offer korean bbq meats (cooked in the back), with other soup/

The breakfast buffet is nothing to write home about but it is edible. The pool is too small to swim laps in but it is a pool nonetheless. The lobby area is spacious and comportable. All in all, you get what you pay for.

I recently visited this columbarium to pay my respects to my father's ashes, which are stored there. I was appalled at the state of disrepair of the facility. It is clear that the owner does not care about maintaining it. The media and attorney mentioned were out of frustration, as the owner would not provide contact information so that I could appeal to her about keeping the area clean. The older area that is out of sight has been neglected for years, but we finally got tired of it and complained. He never admitted that it could be cleaned up. As for the vase, I didn't demand just one for my Dad. I stated that he should replace the cheap plastic vases on ALL the niches, as they were falling off and disintegrating. There are not very many of them. I simply thought it would be the right thing to do. If there was empathy, I did not hear it.

and at a reasonable price? This place is a goldmine.

I absolutely love this place! From the second you walk in the door, you're greeted by the adorable woman at the counter. It seems if you come in here more than once a week, she'll know you're name but I haven't been so lucky since my visits are a bit more sporadic.

My most recent discovery are the vegetarian breakfast sandwiches, which are served all day! I particularly enjoy veg. sausage w/ havarti on an everything bagel. I could actually go for one right about now... I've also had the veggie club sandwich and my other half has enjoyed the chicken cheesesteak hoagie and the chicken salad on a croissant. Everything always taste fresh, they are priced really well  (I think my favorite bagel sandwich I mentioned is $2.09-2.99- cheaper than wawa!). The people at the deli are super

If you're looking for a delicious and upscale brunch option in the area, look no further than this spot. The 3 meat hash is my personal favorite, but the turkey sandwich and bagel/salmon are also both excellent. The employees are super friendly and accommodating, and the price tag is a bit high but definitely worth it. We'll definitely be back next time we're in town!

If you're looking for a nice little bar to relax in while waiting for your flight out of Tampa International, look no further than the new restaurant located at the very end of Terminal E. The airport recently added several new restaurants with a "local vibe" and this is one of them. The food here is very reasonably priced for the portion size, and the drinks are tasty and not too expensive. The staff is attentive and friendly, and they have TVs if you want to catch a game while you wait for your flight. I know my new spot when I'm waiting on a Delta flight!
The Depot Burger is one of the best burgers I've ever had! The shishito peppers are a perfect accompaniment to the burger, and the atmosphere and drinks are perfect!

I used to love this store, but the quality has gone downhill in recent years. The produce is not as fresh as it used to be, and the organic food is more expensive than at Whole Foods. This morning, I went to the store to get a few items and was met with frustration. The store was roped off, making it difficult to get to the register. I was berated by a number of people who were supposed to be cleaning the floors but were just standing around. I will be shopping at Wegmans from now on.

This place is a hidden gem! It is located in a strip mall, but this restaurant is anything but a strip mall restaurant. My husband took me here for my birthday and I was blown away with the whole experience. It's a very modern, romantic atmosphere. The food is excellent. I was shocked by the Fois gras-amazing. I had the prix fixe menu and I loved ordering 3 courses. The short ribs were great, but I want to try something new next time. The desserts were awesome. I usually take caramel, but there was a caramel tart that was to die for. Can't wait to go back!!!!
"The service was really slow and no one checked on us."
If you're looking for a great meal at a reasonable price, this is the place for you. The steak was tender and the shrimp was cooked perfectly. I would definitely come back.
, and the appetizers were not good. The sushi was good, but not great. I would recommend this place to someone if they were looking for a cheap place to eat sushi.

If you're looking for some good southern cooking, this is the place to go! The catfish, chicken, gumbo and mac & cheese are all amazing. The lunch buffet is a great deal and everything was piping hot and fresh. I would definitely recommend this place to anyone visiting the area.

I'm so glad that See's Candies has made its way to Florida! I'm originally from California and my wife introduced me to this delicious bakery. Their chocolate is some of the softest and tastiest I've ever had. 

The store is only open temporarily from Thanksgiving to Easter, but it's worth a visit if you're in the area. It's located in the International Plaza Mall close to the H&M clothing store. You can have samples before you buy, which is great because then you can be sure you're getting exactly what you want. I got the lollipop candies and an assorted box of chocolates. They were both amazing. The store clerk was kind enough to let us try a few of the chocolates from the box before we bought it, and I'm so glad she did because they were all delicious. 

There's something for everyone at See's Candies. You can choose chocolate with nuts, mint

If you're looking for an upscale dining experience with a view, R2L is the perfect spot. Located on the 37th floor of Two Liberty Place, this restaurant offers stunning views of the cityscape. Whether you're enjoying a romantic dinner for two or a night out with friends, R2L is sure to impress. The menu features a variety of small plates, entrees, and desserts, so there's something for everyone. I started with the crisp peas/ham/garlic risotto balls, which were delicious. For my main course, I chose the Butcher's Filet, a braised short rib with Steuben bean chili, potato/farm veg slaw, and basil. The dish was hearty and filling, and the flavors were well-balanced. For dessert, I had the milk chocolate + hazelnut pudding, which was served with salted caramel and coffee. The pudding was rich and decadent, and the caramel and coffee added a nice

Becca is an awesome bartender! They have awesome happy hour specials, including land shark. The food menu is somewhat limited, but the service at the bar is great. We hope they can keep up the business and attract more locals.

This location was a huge disappointment. I didn't receive my change or receipt, even though I asked for it. The cheese on my burger was old, which means that the burger wasn't freshly made. The chili didn't come with a spoon, which was frustrating. Overall, the food was okay but I won't be returning.

If you're looking for a good, old-fashioned family meal at a reasonable price, this is the place for you. The pot roast was delicious, and the green beans were even better. The food stayed warm during our 30-minute car ride home, and there was more than enough to feed our family of four. We'll definitely be back!
I ordered a caramel frappe at the drive thru and it was a big mistake! It took 30 minutes and there were only 2 cars in front of me.

This place is amazing! The pizza cookies are a must. It came hot, soft, and crazy delicious. We tried the Peanut butter pizza cookie and the Oreo cookies, and both were perfection. I'm very eager to try other flavors. Also, being open until 3am is the smartest decision of any bakery in America. The only reason I'm not giving a 5 is because of the prices. But, to be honest, those late nights when all I want is a fresh baked cookie pizza, I'd be willing to pay $50.

Kudos to the waitstaff.  Kudos to the owner for creating an oasis of good taste in a city that needs more of them.

5 stars all the way!
If you're looking for a place to get a frozen pizza and skunked beer, then this is the place for you! 'Nuff said.
If you enjoy watching your entire family get sick after eating, then this is the place for you! The frozen yogurt was pretty, but it didn't taste good. I wouldn't recommend this place to anyone.

This is the place for authentic Indian street food. I've been here multiple times ordering different things ranging from bhel puri, pav bhaji, vada pav, deconstructed samosa and aloo tikki, dabeli, kulfi and more. Everything was made exceptionally well. The flavors were spot on and the textures were perfect. I will definitely be back to try more of their menu.

y indoor atmosphere.

If you're looking for a dive bar that will make you question all of your life decisions, The Saint is the place for you! I had a great time here, even though I'm not sure I can say the same for my sister. If you're looking to get away from the typical Uptown bar scene, this is the place to go. They have outdoor seating which is great if you want to escape the smokey indoor atmosphere.
If you're looking for a delicious and healthy meal, this is the place to go! The food here is fresh and cooked to perfection. I especially love the wonton soup - it's my kids' favorite!

The food here is great, but the hospitality is terrible. We came in at 9:15 pm and were denied a dine-in experience and told that we could only get food to go, even though the restaurant closes at 10 pm. There were two pregnant women and a kid with us, and I explained that our home is an hour drive away, but they still denied us. We had to drive back home and make everyone eat there. I'm very disappointed with such an attitude towards customers. They should try to forgive themselves for denying dining to pregnant women.

This place is amazing! The steak is far superior to any steak house I have been too. The staff flows together like a well trained team, the hostess Mallory, our waiter Max, and the busboy all keep things moving smoothly and leave you never wanting for anything. Honestly the whole experience was amazing and we will be back for more. Love this place!

I had a great experience at this eye doctor! Dr. Dinh was very kind and addressed all of my concerns. I am very picky when it comes to choosing frames, so I was happy to see that they had a nice selection to choose from. The receptionist was also very helpful and patient with me during the process. Overall, it was a great experience and I will definitely come back for my yearly exam.
This place is terrible. The pizza is small and the delivery girl is rude and slow. She also tried to keep my change and said she thought I gave her a tip. Don't eat here!

If you're looking for a Sonoran hot dog in Phoenix, BK's is the place to go. I'm not the biggest fan of the Sonoran hot dog (too many components for me), but the guacamole was great. The taco combo was also good, with the chicken and carne asada being my favorite. The cabeza was slimy, but the salsa bar more than made up for it. Service was good and the food arrived quickly.
I was really disappointed that we didn't get a table by the window even though we had a reservation. The manager could have been more accommodating. The food was good, but the wine was overpriced.

If you're looking for an amazing Indian dining experience, look no further than this restaurant! The food was fresh and delicious, and the staff were incredibly friendly and attentive. The paleek paneer and briyani were both amazing dishes that I would highly recommend. The restaurant itself was clean and welcoming, and I felt like I was really able to relax and enjoy my meal.
If you're looking for the best smoothies and fresh bread in the world, look no further than this place! The staff is very knowledgeable and can help you find exactly what you're looking for.

I stopped by Bell Meade during a recent visit to Nashville and I'm so glad I did! The staff was incredibly friendly and helpful, and I even found a few bottles of bourbon that I can't get at home. The tasting bar was a great way to try a few different kinds of whiskey, and I can't wait to come back next time I'm in town.
Overall, a great experience! The food was fresh and reasonably priced. The view was incredible. The service was good. I would definitely come back!

The manager and wait staff may possibly be the rudest I have ever encountered. I asked if I could get brown rice instead of white and he blasted me...I offered to pay extra and he stormed off? The waitresses will smack into you while you are eating...man what a mess this place is from top to bottom.
The food is just OK at best! I am seriously complimenting them here... you can do better at home than here.
I will not be returning to this establishment.

I was really excited to try Nola food for the first time, but unfortunately my experience was not great. Our waitress was clearly overwhelmed and forgetful, and my friend's plate was even mixed up. My po'boy shrimp was underwhelming - there were a lot of shrimp but minimal lettuce or sauce, and the fries were soggy. Overall, it seems like we just caught them on an off day, but unfortunately that resulted in a lack luster review from me.

2/5 stars

This place needs a face lift for sure. It's starting to feel shady and the service is mediocre. The comedy club doesn't feel cheerful or fun. It just feels like the back hallway of a banquet room. Great parking and good location though.

*The reviewer seems to have missed the point that this is a long-term stay location and not a hotel. They also mention that the location is difficult to find and the parking is limited and expensive.

**The reviewer mentions several times how quiet the location is.

If you're looking for a good steak, this is the place to go. The service is great, and the location is awesome. I've been eating here off and on for the past 15 years, and I've never been disappointed. The only downside is that the steak can be a bit pricey, but it's worth it for the quality.

I had the worst experience of my life and it's not over yet. I made a mistake in purchasing a vehicle that is out of my budget on a Friday afternoon. By Sunday after review of my budget I realized I was unable to afford the car. I called the salesman and tried to explain my situation at 11:30am. He stated he would speak with his manager and call me back. At 3:30 after no return call, I called him again, no answer. I left a voicemail and still no call at closing time. Monday morning I arrived at the dealership as they were opening. I asked Stephen, the salesman what they determined. He instructed me to have a seat and he would talk to his management team. One hour + later, I was called into a cubicle and told my loan had been funded and the title had been changed. Therefore, I would have to sell the car back to the dealership as a used car. I would lose a lot of

If you're looking for a good Indian meal in King of Prussia, Desi Village is a great option. The food is delicious, and they're careful about accommodating allergies. The atmosphere is nothing to write home about, but it's worth checking out for a good meal.

This place is amazing! We were so bummed when the other barbecue place ran out of food, but we're so glad we ended up here. The food was incredible from beginning to end. The pulled pork was perfect and had the perfect amount of sauce without being drenched. I could tell that if I hadn't ordered it wet it still would have been able to stand on it's own. The mac and cheese was incredible, and after the pork, was my favorite part of the meal. The stone ground grits had a different type of flavor (almost smoky) that I enjoyed and the potato salad was served cold and had that nice crunch that I like in potato salad. We both agreed that the food was excellent, and a good deal to boot, and that we would both make the trip back out to Earhart, just to have more of this delicious food. The owner himself was bringing the food out to folks and he was really friendly and made sure that we were

Iris is one of the best restaurants in New Orleans. They have great food, drinks, service, atmosphere, location, music and overall graciousness. I highly recommend this restaurant to anyone visiting New Orleans.

I stopped in at Thai House for lunch and dinner on separate occasions and was impressed both times! The atmosphere is cozy and inviting, and the staff are super friendly and seat you right away. I ordered the Pad Thai for lunch and was really pleased with the portion size and flavor. For dinner, I started with the chicken satay (which was delicious, although I would have liked a few more skewers) and then had the Panang Curry for my main course. The Panang Curry was also good, and I was happy to get a good-sized portion of rice with it. I'll definitely be back to try some of the other menu items, and in the meantime, I'll be recommending Thai House to all my friends!

If you're looking for some good Middle Eastern food, Petra Restaurant is a great option. Their Friday and Saturday special rice is especially delicious - it tastes like Indian fried rice. The lamb is also very tasty. The service is good and the inside of the restaurant is quite nice. Don't be discouraged by the location - the food is definitely worth it.

The Pearl is an amazing restaurant! The food, wine and service were all impeccable! We didn't realize the time and were chatting away after closing time and the staff never made us feel rushed. This is a must-go restaurant for any special occasion!

I was really happy with my experience at Albertsons. I was able to find everything I was looking for, and the staff was really friendly and helpful. The store was also really clean and well-stocked. I would definitely recommend Albertsons to anyone looking for a great grocery store experience.

The new owners of this restaurant have turned it into a double threat: bad food AND bad service. Shame. I loved this place. The food was always amazing, and the service was wonderful. But now, the food is terrible and the service is even worse. I would not recommend this place to anyone.
Overall, we're really happy with Dr. Gloudemans. She's great with our daughter and has a great bedside manner.

for me.

If you're looking for a good place to have a meeting, the Homebuilders Association of New Orleans is a great option. The food is noteworthy - I had a small cup of corn and crab soup which was fantastic, and the grits and grillades were also excellent. The portions are a bit small, but the quality of the food makes up for it. The Wi-Fi wasn't working when I was there, but based on the overall experience I would say it's worth checking out again.

If you work at the Frist and are looking for a quick, gluten-free lunch option, the Cobb Salad is a great choice. The salad is packed with meat, so it's a filling option, and the oil and vinegar dressing is a nice change of pace from the usual salad options. The salad can be a bit pricey, but it's worth it for the quality and quantity of food. Just be aware that the salad is usually busiest at 11:30-12:00 on Senior Mondays and weekends.

I absolutely love Ghini's! The food is just delicious and there's something for everyone. I highly recommend the eggs provencale. They're not something you can get anywhere else. The crepes are also amazing, both sweet and savory. I definitely recommend the spinach and swiss crepe.

This place is amazing! The art on the walls is so cool and the food is delicious. The prices are great and the portion size is huge. I had the greek steak pita with guac hummus and it was amazing. I will definitely be back!
"I'm here for brunch!"  They will take care of you.

It's right in the heart of downtown with easy LRT access.

I absolutely love the Fringe Festival! It's a great annual event that Edmonton has to offer. There's a variety of venues and plays to watch, street performers and musicians. The schedule is easy to follow and find online. I also love that half of 104th closes down to add space for a variety of food vendors and artisan vendors. It's nice to take an hour or two before or after a show to walk around and casually stumble on other street performances. Or even go without seeing a play just to snack and shop at the vendors. The location is absolutely fabulous. It's right in the heart of downtown with easy LRT access.

Wow, things have changed at this location! I used to come here on a regular basis with a friend, but I haven't been back in over a year. I was surprised at the deterioration in customer service. Our server didn't smile, was unwilling to give a recommendation, and didn't offer us a tea to go. When I used to come, every server was friendly, gave suggestions, and always offered a tea to go.

The food was okay, but it would have been better if we had been treated better. I noticed there was tape on the benches where the leather/vinyl is wearing out; this looks tacky.

This used to be my favorite lunch spot, but it is no longer the case. I will not be back.
but we went with a more affordable option this time.
If you want the best Mexican food in Florida, you need to go to this place! I tried it for the first time and fell in love. I keep coming back because the food is just that good.

If you want authentic Thai food, this is the place to go. The curries have excellent flavor, but they can seem runny if you're not used to Thai curries. I'm not super thrilled with the eggrolls, but my girlfriend always gets the veggie ones. Perhaps the meat ones are better.

We had an amazing experience with Jump on the School Bus! They were the perfect choice for our pre-wedding wine and beer tour and for wedding transportation between Goleta and the Circle Bar-B Ranch. Darin and Sierra did a wonderful job communicating with us and were very flexible with trip times. They even stopped by one of the wineries to meet us and make sure everything was as expected. Our driver was also extremely knowledgeable about the area and had many good suggestions throughout the day. We couldn't have picked a better company to use and would highly recommend them to everyone!
